commit_message:
Defines a Credentials class

Multiversion auth part4

Introduces a Credential class.
Base class and V2 credentials are defined. V3 in the next patch.
Using Credentials, it becomes transparent for client managers and
tests which auth version is being used.
Defines a get_default_credentials utils, which is solely responsible
for reading credentials from CONF.
Defines a get_credentials, which builds V2 credentials
based on configuration.

Credentials are not used in tests yet, only by AuthProvider.
AuthProvider supports dict credentials in this patch for
backwards compatibility. Credentials are verified via unit test.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I5f8ab7ef37c99d2c2425b8487490e3517cfce7ed

subject: Add include_disabled param to pkg search
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7562, 'name': 'Dmitry Teselkin', 'email': 'dteselkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dteselkin'}, {'_account_id': 7600, 'name': 'Ruslan Kamaldinov', 'email': 'rkamaldinov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ruhe'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 11096, 'name': 'Ankur Rishi', 'email': 'ankur.rishi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ankurrishi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-25 19:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['muranoapi/api/v1/__init__.py', 'muranoapi/db/catalog/api.py'], 'message': "Add include_disabled param to pkg search

Currently, the api endpoint function for listing
packages returns all packages by default.  This
commit adds a new 'include_disabled' parameter
which, when specified by an admin as 'True',
results in the packages search results including
disabled packages from all users in addition to
all enabled packages.

When the include_disabled parameter is specified
'True' by non-admins, the search will include
both all enabled packages (public and owned), plus
only the disabled packages owned by the searcher.

If a non-admin specifies 'True' for the
include_disabled paramater AND also specifies
the 'owned' parameter, then the non-admin gets
all of their own packages, public and private,
both enabled and disabled.

This commit effectively disables the 'owned'
parameter for admin users.  It is the only way
to make the package search API function
usable for both generating views of packages
for deployment as well as views of packages
for editing packages.

Change-Id: I28dfc49e1559dd9f0a87b89936df3e4b5c938264
Partial-Bug: #1307963
"}]
commit_message:
Add include_disabled param to pkg search

Currently, the api endpoint function for listing
packages returns all packages by default.  This
commit adds a new 'include_disabled' parameter
which, when specified by an admin as 'True',
results in the packages search results including
disabled packages from all users in addition to
all enabled packages.

When the include_disabled parameter is specified
'True' by non-admins, the search will include
both all enabled packages (public and owned), plus
only the disabled packages owned by the searcher.

If a non-admin specifies 'True' for the
include_disabled paramater AND also specifies
the 'owned' parameter, then the non-admin gets
all of their own packages, public and private,
both enabled and disabled.

This commit effectively disables the 'owned'
parameter for admin users.  It is the only way
to make the package search API function
usable for both generating views of packages
for deployment as well as views of packages
for editing packages.

Change-Id: I28dfc49e1559dd9f0a87b89936df3e4b5c938264
Partial-Bug: #1307963

commit_message:
Verify certificate API response attributes

Now most attributes of Nova v2/v3 APIs are not checked in Tempest,
and this patch adds some tests which check these attributes to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

This patch adds the checks of certificate API responses.
The response body of this API is the following:
{
    'certificate': {
        'data': 'Certificate:\n    Data:\n        Version:...',
        'private_key': '-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\nM...'
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I5e97cfb5be56b4fa8de5d7262375b5b5b6de1b2a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 14:31:29.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/climate'], 'message': 'Set osapi_compute_extensions default value

The Devstack commit 3317437caca5eb769ab4c6d3ea7c5d3e062517e2 removed
the osapi_compute_extensions configuration option from lib/nova.
This caused that when our Devstack implementation sets this
configuration option, the default value were missed. This default value
is important because is the one that loads all the default Nova
extensions, which causes a lot of HTTP 404 at Nova API.
For this reason, our Devstack implementation was modified in order to
set this default value when this option is not set by any other project.

Change-Id: I04698643ac00b4b52b05f28a6c46522991734fc4
Closes-Bug: #1312368
'}]
commit_message:
Set osapi_compute_extensions default value

The Devstack commit 3317437caca5eb769ab4c6d3ea7c5d3e062517e2 removed
the osapi_compute_extensions configuration option from lib/nova.
This caused that when our Devstack implementation sets this
configuration option, the default value were missed. This default value
is important because is the one that loads all the default Nova
extensions, which causes a lot of HTTP 404 at Nova API.
For this reason, our Devstack implementation was modified in order to
set this default value when this option is not set by any other project.

Change-Id: I04698643ac00b4b52b05f28a6c46522991734fc4
Closes-Bug: #1312368

subject: Add SwiftSortingMethod parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 16:30:57.000000000', 'files': ['swift-storage-source.yaml', 'swift-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Add SwiftSortingMethod parameter

Add SwiftSortingMethod to notCompute0Config and SwiftStorage0Config
swift metadata.

This parameter is used by swift to determine how
storage nodes are chosen. Valid values are shuffle (choose nodes at random),
timing (by using timing measurements), or affinity (by using an explicit match).

The default SwiftSortingMethod is shuffle.

The following is added to tripleo-image-elements proxy-server.conf:

{{#swift.sorting-method}}
sorting_method = {{swift.sorting-method}}
{{/swift.sorting-method}}

See https://review.openstack.org/83323

Change-Id: I3c1f2a010129c7a8a442695257fd742edf6545e3
'}]
commit_message:
Add SwiftSortingMethod parameter

Add SwiftSortingMethod to notCompute0Config and SwiftStorage0Config
swift metadata.

This parameter is used by swift to determine how
storage nodes are chosen. Valid values are shuffle (choose nodes at random),
timing (by using timing measurements), or affinity (by using an explicit match).

The default SwiftSortingMethod is shuffle.

The following is added to tripleo-image-elements proxy-server.conf:

{{#swift.sorting-method}}
sorting_method = {{swift.sorting-method}}
{{/swift.sorting-method}}

See https://review.openstack.org/83323

Change-Id: I3c1f2a010129c7a8a442695257fd742edf6545e3

commit_message:
Allow to set seed node cpus and memory

Increasing the number of cpus and the memory for the seed vm,
has impact in the time needed to boot the undercloud when the
images are built compressed  (without the -u option).
Booting times of the undercloud are reduced about 35% (More data
in the bug comments)

This can be done with the SEED_CPU and SEED_MEM (MB) env.
variables. (Defaults to 1 CPU and 2048M RAM, as current ones)

Partial-Bug: #1295732

Change-Id: Iac68701408696ae1eb598bbf7e2a3d0ad877e116

commit_message:
Get use-pip-manifest to ignore '-e' dev versions

This patch gets use-pip-manifest to also ignore pip entries
introduced with the -e specifier, as they are editable
development versions, rather than versioned packages.

Change-Id: I581eebb3db5595d9b0e6154f9f78e19ccf0bca6b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-04-27 10:54:59.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rabbitmq-server/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/40-rabbitmq'], 'message': 'RabbitMQ - Ensure node name comparisons are case insensitive

Heat generated hostnames can have uppercase letters, while cloud-init
will convert these to all lowercase. By ensuring comparisons are case
insensitive, the `if [ "$MASTER" = "$LOCAL" ]` etc tests succeed.

Change-Id: I3806f5e8beb3e9043e1d1c88bcdfe525af940971
'}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ - Ensure node name comparisons are case insensitive

Heat generated hostnames can have uppercase letters, while cloud-init
will convert these to all lowercase. By ensuring comparisons are case
insensitive, the `if [ "$MASTER" = "$LOCAL" ]` etc tests succeed.

Change-Id: I3806f5e8beb3e9043e1d1c88bcdfe525af940971

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-24 16:50:37.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/orchestration/stacks/test_server_cfn_init.py', 'tempest/api/orchestration/base.py'], 'message': 'orchestration api refactor access to stack outputs

Refactor test_server_cfn_init access to stack outputs so it uses
a new wrapper which gets the stack and returns the requested
output.  This provides a useful function which can be used in
other tests which parse the stack output.  Since we no longer
need to get the stack in test_server_cfn_init, remove the gets
and duplicate checks for CREATE_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: If1d0990ac9467b6e9778e4444b2ec5fc0f1e44e7
'}]
commit_message:
orchestration api refactor access to stack outputs

Refactor test_server_cfn_init access to stack outputs so it uses
a new wrapper which gets the stack and returns the requested
output.  This provides a useful function which can be used in
other tests which parse the stack output.  Since we no longer
need to get the stack in test_server_cfn_init, remove the gets
and duplicate checks for CREATE_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: If1d0990ac9467b6e9778e4444b2ec5fc0f1e44e7

commit_message:
Refactored cleaner and added cleanup/utils

Moved context/cleaner to its own package, called cleanup, under
benchmark.context and renamed it to cleanup.py. To improve cohesion,
splitted benchmark/utils.py into two, and all cleanup related functions
were moved to benchmark.context.cleanup.utils. Removed cleanup function
in cleanup.py and references to it, since it's obsolete. Finally updated
all references and unit tests accordingly to reflect the changes.

bp benchmark-context-cleanup-refactor
Change-Id: Iaffc4e35e21b734a7b4cb77ffaf810112054ebae

commit_message:
Change agent_id to id in the response of agent API

When creating a new entity, most APIs return a response which includes
"id" to represent a new id. However, only agent API returns "agent_id"
as a new entity. This behavior seems inconsistent from the viewpoint
of whole Nova API.

This patch changes it to "id".

subject: Storwize/SVC driver detach volume failed
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-27 06:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': "Storwize/SVC driver detach volume failed

If config two backends on the same storage, but the protocol is
different, one is FC and the other is iSCSI,  that will create two
hosts on the storage.

When detaching the volume which is attached to the iSCSI host, the
driver will get FC host by default, that causes volume status keeps
'detaching'.

Change-Id: Idbdb3861574197549625b4a6b6141197e42857ff
Closes-Bug: #1310559
"}]
commit_message:
Storwize/SVC driver detach volume failed

If config two backends on the same storage, but the protocol is
different, one is FC and the other is iSCSI,  that will create two
hosts on the storage.

When detaching the volume which is attached to the iSCSI host, the
driver will get FC host by default, that causes volume status keeps
'detaching'.

Change-Id: Idbdb3861574197549625b4a6b6141197e42857ff
Closes-Bug: #1310559

subject: Fixes "bad format" in replicator for valid hosts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5600, 'name': 'Brian Cline', 'email': 'bcline@softlayer.com', 'username': 'briancline'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 10327, 'name': 'Feng Xi Yan', 'email': 'yanfengxi@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'yanfengxi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-04-15 03:01:33.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'glance/common/utils.py', 'requirements.txt', 'glance/cmd/replicator.py'], 'message': 'Fixes "bad format" in replicator for valid hosts

Due to a bad regex, the glance-replicator tool rejects any source or
target host:port combination that contains a period. As a result, only
hostnames without periods can be used.

This fix expands the host/port checks to:
  - allow periods in hostnames
  - allow and verify IPv6 addr/port pairs (i.e., [fe80::f00d:face]:1234)
  - allow and verify IPv4 addr/port pairs (i.e., 172.17.17.2:1234)
  - sanity-check port numbers

This also includes extensive tests for each component of the parsing,
and adds network_utils to openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I94fdd7a57a4cb0aa5d79f66d68be159d1f1266d1
Closes-Bug: #1216247
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes "bad format" in replicator for valid hosts

Due to a bad regex, the glance-replicator tool rejects any source or
target host:port combination that contains a period. As a result, only
hostnames without periods can be used.

This fix expands the host/port checks to:
  - allow periods in hostnames
  - allow and verify IPv6 addr/port pairs (i.e., [fe80::f00d:face]:1234)
  - allow and verify IPv4 addr/port pairs (i.e., 172.17.17.2:1234)
  - sanity-check port numbers

This also includes extensive tests for each component of the parsing,
and adds network_utils to openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I94fdd7a57a4cb0aa5d79f66d68be159d1f1266d1
Closes-Bug: #1216247

commit_message:
Remove email as optional query parameter

Since in keystone it was decided that a user's email won't be taken as a
first class attribute, it is then needed to get it off the API as it is
not an attribute with which you can filter users.

Change-Id: I4b481d2b23013d23060cfae5f4d442d5c8024fec

commit_message:
Add backup size validation test group

Reasons:
 - users are able to pass backup to restoring
   call that has size bigger than
   volume/disk can handle.
Changes:
 - adding validation to backup size according
   to volume size or flavor root disk.
 - test int group proposed.

Change-Id: I08b7b9c09d03412ee36760f293fa61c433840ec7
Closes-Bug: #1304603

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 10:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/policy.json', 'cinder/tests/policy.json', 'cinder/openstack/common/policy.py', 'cinder/policy.py', 'cinder/tests/test_policy.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Support new format in policy.json in cinder

Merged in the openstack-common policy codes from nova to keep the new
format in policy.json in cinder supported in the same way with that in
nova and other components. The cinder-specific policy and test bits are
also updated for the new format. The policy.json is just changed in the
format.

Implements: blueprint cinder-new-policy.json-format
Closes-Bug: #1279263
Change-Id: I129a4be90ce37ceb05fdc9c0ba9116b7e7f115b7
'}]
commit_message:
Support new format in policy.json in cinder

Merged in the openstack-common policy codes from nova to keep the new
format in policy.json in cinder supported in the same way with that in
nova and other components. The cinder-specific policy and test bits are
also updated for the new format. The policy.json is just changed in the
format.

Implements: blueprint cinder-new-policy.json-format
Closes-Bug: #1279263
Change-Id: I129a4be90ce37ceb05fdc9c0ba9116b7e7f115b7

commit_message:
Remove conversion debug message

Removing unnecessary debug message confusing the user to
think the error is fatal. Instead just let it pass silently
to avoid confusion. The debug message wasnt adding much
value anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1306280

Change-Id: I03420311f0a6ec77d68b750afce3c4110ccffecf

commit_message:
Make sure NetworkInterfaces and SubnetId updatable

We should make the properties 'NetworkInterfaces' and 'SubnetId'
updatable for AWS::EC2::Instance resource, so we can update the networks
for an instance.

Change-Id: I4a475fee6416696558807c189473a90d7517cfc0
Closes-Bug: #1280151

If enable_instance_password is set to False in nova.conf, the response
of "create a server" API does not contain AdminPass/admin_password.
In addition, the response already is checked with JSON schema definition.
So test_create_server_response became unnecessary.

commit_message:
Remove test_create_server_response

If enable_instance_password is set to False in nova.conf, the response
of "create a server" API does not contain AdminPass/admin_password.
In addition, the response already is checked with JSON schema definition.
So test_create_server_response became unnecessary.

Change-Id: Id62a8d447c36eaf0b1f64a93929c4cfa2c20e2ae

commit_message:
Fix start_timestamp/end_timestamp in alarm-history

Currently, ceilometer cannot support start_timestamp/end_timestamp in
query field of alarm-history.
This patch enable the two query filters as its presentation.

Change-Id: I98dce9e38f07fd9cc938b4cea4d5ea70bb58a0e8
Closes-bug: #1291171

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-16 03:31:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

function in compute/manager.py _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will translate the migrate status from finished to error
whenever it find a problem , consider following case

1) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes running, it found several migrations to be confirmed
2) user want to delete an instance ,its task state will be changed to DELETING
3) _poll_unconfirmed_resized will found the task state is not None,
   it will make the migration error status
4) following code in _delete
if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:
                self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance)
will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found erro
so we don't need to handle this kind of error for them

Change-Id: I1981f4c2eaad05d64934031494f7b5d3f5b5d098
Closes-Bug: #1301696
"}]
commit_message:
Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

function in compute/manager.py _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will translate the migrate status from finished to error
whenever it find a problem , consider following case

1) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes running, it found several migrations to be confirmed
2) user want to delete an instance ,its task state will be changed to DELETING
3) _poll_unconfirmed_resized will found the task state is not None,
   it will make the migration error status
4) following code in _delete
if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:
                self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance)
will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found erro
so we don't need to handle this kind of error for them

Change-Id: I1981f4c2eaad05d64934031494f7b5d3f5b5d098
Closes-Bug: #1301696

commit_message:
Add missing configuration steps for the heat installation

Heat requires additional configurations to be able to use more advanced
template features:
- a heat_stack_user role must be defined
- heat_metadata_server_url and heat_waitcondition_server_url must be
  defined

Change-Id: I3dde4c0620ef675c6d80debdbad0170c49a82558
Closes-Bug: #1311998

commit_message:
Fix format of table "Additional Security Features"

In chapter "40. Hypervisor Selection" of the security-guide, the table
under the heading "Additional Security Features" used an inconsistent
formatting: mix of upper-/lowercase "X", additional whitespace, and in
one case an extra "<address>" tag. Fixed.

Link to the current online version:
http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/ch051_vss-intro.html#ch051_vss-intro-idp401408

Change-Id: I9333ff78b9429a1429cca279c4aa71940f3ec3f5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-26 20:57:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/security-guide/ch051_vss-intro.xml'], 'message': 'Fix format/typos in table "Cryptography Standards"

In chapter "40. Hypervisor Selection" of the security-guide, the table

missing or extra spaces, extra line breaks, and inconsistent wording
for key lengths.

In addition, key lengths for serpent and twofish were incorrectly given

Change-Id: Ibf7013b1aaff424a56190e8116e1fcba01c3b252

commit_message:
Fix format/typos in table "Cryptography Standards"

In chapter "40. Hypervisor Selection" of the security-guide, the table
under the heading "Cryptography Standards" had some formatting issues:
missing or extra spaces, extra line breaks, and inconsistent wording
for key lengths.

In addition, key lengths for serpent and twofish were incorrectly given
as 196 bits where they should be 192 bits.

Capitalization may need work, too, but I'm not sure I'd get it all
right.

Change-Id: Ibf7013b1aaff424a56190e8116e1fcba01c3b252

commit_message:
Swift config-ref: include some unused tables

Several configuration options tables were not included in the config-ref
for swift. This patch includes most of those tables.

Remove the swift-swift-bench-bench.xml table (swift-bench is not part of
the swift repository anymore).

The realm synchronization tables are not included, they need a proper
documentation (coming in another patch).

Change-Id: Id7be936b02e3932e32ebd2468884df58ebd2b9b7

subject: Respect inmutable resolv.conf in the image
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 23:35:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/img-functions'], 'message': "Respect inmutable resolv.conf in the image

In some instances, the content of the image may want to convey specific
resolv.conf settings. For instance, if unbound is installed, it's also
desirable to set resolv.conf to point to it.

Short circuit diskimage-builder's friendliness around resolv.conf files
by not dying in a fire if it finds the file to be immutable.

Change-Id: I88632fb79289681dcf95d32f39a0ad658ba39a60
"}]
commit_message:
Respect inmutable resolv.conf in the image

In some instances, the content of the image may want to convey specific
resolv.conf settings. For instance, if unbound is installed, it's also
desirable to set resolv.conf to point to it.

Short circuit diskimage-builder's friendliness around resolv.conf files
by not dying in a fire if it finds the file to be immutable.

Change-Id: I88632fb79289681dcf95d32f39a0ad658ba39a60

of WSGI apps declared in a configuration file.
Paste Deploy was used to create the pipeline since it is used by many other
OpenStack projects and it is an active project
with new contributors and supports Python 3. Dependency on Paste is
localized so switching to another library would not be hard if OpenStack moves

commit_message:
Replace hard coded WSGI application creation

This change replaces the hard coded WSGI app creation with a pipeline
of WSGI apps declared in a configuration file.
Paste Deploy was used to create the pipeline since it is used by many other
OpenStack projects and it is an active project
with new contributors and supports Python 3. Dependency on Paste is
localized so switching to another library would not be hard if OpenStack moves
to another package in the future.

The changes are small but the changes for the tests were large since many
acl tests were assuming a hard coded WSGI app creation.

blueprint declarative-filters
Change-Id: I5ce05eab980271873269eca2945dc809f2923045

commit_message:
Verify attributes through Nova os-security-groups API

This patch adds checks whether a response of Nova security group
get/create/update API includes the attributes to block the backward
incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of v2 get/create/update API is the below:
{
    "security_group": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "sg1",
        "tenant_id": "bd9a4c2ed39e49f4aa525e99a5f92454",
        "rules": [],
        "description": "Test security group."
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I7888e1e483ff77adcaf2bd9a38676bd2075e1305

commit_message:
Don't use deprecated nova libvirt conf names

libvirt_cpu_mode was renamed to libvirt.cpu_mode
libvirt_type was renamed to libvirt.virt_type

This patch is needed before I346ee0248c03e60716bd7dc4a5ee4493610867cb can
land.

Backported to stable/icehouse so that grenade will work, since we use
nova.conf set by old (stable/icehouse) when upgrading to new. Also this
config was deprecated in icehouse.

Change-Id: Ie8a39147ece3a3c86f4b146fa0af3641b1079319
(cherry picked from commit 1cd8efc89073a2867c8e2bd3a79d6887a180a590)

revisions:

Since force delete volume apis are only admin apis, force detach volume api

Closes-Bug: #1303882
Change-Id: I12f927e816a5ba6809da9a27ac4ad150546286a1

commit_message:
Force detach should only be an admin api

Since force delete volume apis are only admin apis, force detach volume api
should also be an admin only api.  Currently, the force detach api,
which uses the default rule in policy.json, can be called by admins and owners.
This patch make force detach volume api an admin only api like force
delete volume.

Closes-Bug: #1303882
Change-Id: I12f927e816a5ba6809da9a27ac4ad150546286a1
(cherry picked from commit 3af76d3677641c6e32b7dc0ef71ec464fb336a8f)

Note: the following test was removed 'test_terminate_no_fixed_ips' as

commit_message:
Remove unneeded call to fetch network info on shutdown

There is no reason to fetch the network_info from the network api on shutdown
since we can just pull it out of the local cache. There are probably other
places where this call to the network api call can be removed but this patch
just handles the case for shutdown.

Note: the following test was removed 'test_terminate_no_fixed_ips' as
the call to the network api is no longer done so this test would be the
same as test_terminate_no_network.

Closes-bug: #1288392

Change-Id: Ifbf751739c215e566926719f481c03e2c064163a
(cherry picked from commit c47900064f2f3b4384cfa3fd6fe21f452514fa36)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 01:01:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "remove unneeded call to network_api on rebuild_instance

When rebuilding an instance we call the network_api and which results in
calling neutron and updating the info cache. We do not actually need to
do this as we can get the nw_info directly from the instance's info cache.

Change-Id: I2bcc2f15b1e5bb52d972098c7bc3e12f160b6feb
Closes-bug: 1294914
(cherry picked from commit 982850f0e912e1a72e501e456cb2b5ef94124ca6)
"}]
commit_message:
remove unneeded call to network_api on rebuild_instance

When rebuilding an instance we call the network_api and which results in
calling neutron and updating the info cache. We do not actually need to
do this as we can get the nw_info directly from the instance's info cache.

Change-Id: I2bcc2f15b1e5bb52d972098c7bc3e12f160b6feb
Closes-bug: 1294914
(cherry picked from commit 982850f0e912e1a72e501e456cb2b5ef94124ca6)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-24 01:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary call to fetch info_cache

The _heal_instance_info cache() always accesses instance['info_cache']
therefore we should always load the info_cache so we can avoid the extra
query to fetch it.

Change-Id: I3c2e005b98abf2a80276562cc05e88ba5ff199bc
Closes-bug: #1309239
(cherry picked from commit 5aa29b6b0a34d603e882a80cdc8e936f983b1892)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary call to fetch info_cache

The _heal_instance_info cache() always accesses instance['info_cache']
therefore we should always load the info_cache so we can avoid the extra
query to fetch it.

Change-Id: I3c2e005b98abf2a80276562cc05e88ba5ff199bc
Closes-bug: #1309239
(cherry picked from commit 5aa29b6b0a34d603e882a80cdc8e936f983b1892)

[{'number': 34, 'created': '2014-03-13 19:19:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/test_common.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/limits.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/test_xml.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_limits.py', 'nova/api/openstack/common.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/used_limits.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_used_limits.py'], 'message': "Get quota and usage from neutron for limit APIs

module to raise the HTTP error back to the client.

a good 401/403 choice in NovaException already. There is a NotAuthorized
exception but it sets a 403 code, and there is a NotAllowed
NovaException but that's for a 405. So rather than define new confusing
NovaExceptions, this patch just sets the code in the NovaException that

translate it.

common abstract methods in nova.network.api.API so that nova-network and
Neutron can be handled the same way in os-compute API, but that's for a
later patch since it's a good bit of work and not necessary for this bug
fix.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

"}]
commit_message:
Get quota and usage from neutron for limit APIs

On a system configured to use Neutron, for limit API, we should retrieve
quota and usage for floating IPs and security groups from Neutron,
rather than Nova DB.

We do this just in V2 API since leaving the limits code broken in V2 API
when working with Neutron is the wrong choice. In V3 API we have better
separation between Nova and Neutron since Nova doesn't proxy any
requests to Neutron for V3.

In this patch the neutronv2 API translates NuetronClientException to
NovaException with the proper code (401, 403 or 500) and that is raised
back to the os-compute API which uses the new error map in the common
module to raise the HTTP error back to the client.

The status code stuff with NovaException is a bit ugly, but there wasn't
a good 401/403 choice in NovaException already. There is a NotAuthorized
exception but it sets a 403 code, and there is a NotAllowed
NovaException but that's for a 405. So rather than define new confusing
NovaExceptions, this patch just sets the code in the NovaException that
comes back from the neutronv2 API and lets the os-compute API code
translate it.

There are also TODOs in the os-compute API code to eventually define
common abstract methods in nova.network.api.API so that nova-network and
Neutron can be handled the same way in os-compute API, but that's for a
later patch since it's a good bit of work and not necessary for this bug
fix.

Co-Authored-By: GuoHui Liu <guohliu@cn.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1186354

Change-Id: I53fbeb165fb22d65f16af011e0a6c602944a1730

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-10 02:16:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Keep instance state when no host found for resize

In Scheduler prep_resize, instance will be set back to ACTIVE state
if exception NoValidHost is raised. but in compute layer, if
there is no host or found same host while resize to same host is
not allowed, first the instance will be set to ERROR state then
MigrationError will be raised. It will cause the instance to be
ERROR state. This patch modify the exception raised.

Closes-Bug: #1289174

Change-Id: Ib3f1a810ed38bc42743e7572c2b278cfbfca1787
'}]
commit_message:
Keep instance state when no host found for resize

In Scheduler prep_resize, instance will be set back to ACTIVE state
if exception NoValidHost is raised. but in compute layer, if
there is no host or found same host while resize to same host is
not allowed, first the instance will be set to ERROR state then
MigrationError will be raised. It will cause the instance to be
ERROR state. This patch modify the exception raised.

Closes-Bug: #1289174

commit_message:
Fix the return of statistic with getting no sample

In mysql scenario, when getting statistics with no sample
(this can be presented with invalid value of sample filters), ceilometer
will raise an error about NoneType.
Like other API of ceilometer, it should return an empty list.

Change-Id: I07cbc3f03f7a5e6751e6851f14ed1cdc16ee4a4c
Closes-bug: #1292322

subject: Deprecate admin_token option in auth_token
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-17 16:20:54.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Deprecate admin_token option in auth_token

The admin_token option shouldn't be used with the auth_token
middleware. It's used to specify a token to be used to perform
operations on the identity server, so would typically be set
to the admin token. The admin token should only be used to
initially set up the Keystone server, and then the admin token
functionality should be disabled. If this recommended setup is
used then the auth_token middleware shouldn't be using the
admin token / auth_token.

In preparing for removal of the admin_token option, the option
is now deprecated. A warning will be logged if it's set.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5bc4f4a6ad7984892151c8011ccd92f166aba4c2
Closes-Bug: #1306981
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate admin_token option in auth_token

The admin_token option shouldn't be used with the auth_token
middleware. It's used to specify a token to be used to perform
operations on the identity server, so would typically be set
to the admin token. The admin token should only be used to
initially set up the Keystone server, and then the admin token
functionality should be disabled. If this recommended setup is
used then the auth_token middleware shouldn't be using the
admin token / auth_token.

In preparing for removal of the admin_token option, the option
is now deprecated. A warning will be logged if it's set.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5bc4f4a6ad7984892151c8011ccd92f166aba4c2
Closes-Bug: #1306981

subject: Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 13:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'recipes/common.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': "Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [network-api-bind]
namespace, in addition to standardising on IP discovery by using the 'endpoint'
method as used in the other cookbooks.

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I2eecb7601a426e3611d5c9c4a10b49863fc4e48d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [network-api-bind]
namespace, in addition to standardising on IP discovery by using the 'endpoint'
method as used in the other cookbooks.

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I2eecb7601a426e3611d5c9c4a10b49863fc4e48d

subject: Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP
revisions:

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [block-storage-api-bind] namespace

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I6cf4c5726ce0b12a95c374883c7181ade04b59dd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [block-storage-api-bind] namespace

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

subject: Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 13:37:52.000000000', 'files': ['spec/common_spec.rb', 'recipes/common.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [network-api-bind]
namespace.

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I4e134a5dc24ace58a7b9cb2705e66a7b17fd2554
'}]
commit_message:
Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [network-api-bind]
namespace.

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I4e134a5dc24ace58a7b9cb2705e66a7b17fd2554

commit_message:
Emit a log statement when releasing internal lock

The log statement, with debug severity, is added to the lock
function in order to ensure lock release is logged also when
using lockutils.lock

Change-Id: I362cc743f49ddb6476f9d2b21a3ed02f96fcc135
Closes-Bug: 1312813

subject: Don't allow queries with 'IN' predicate with an empty sequence
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 7478, 'name': 'Nadya Shakhat', 'email': 'nadmi4@gmail.com', 'username': 'nprivalova'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 16:08:11.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/storage/test_storage_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_complex_query.py'], 'message': 'Don't allow queries with 'IN' predicate with an empty sequence

While SQLalchemy-based storage tests running
(test_storage_scenarios.test_query_filter_with_empty_in) there was
invoked SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "sample.resource_id" with
an empty sequence.

Reason is in not checking of 'in' query lists elements number.
These queries make no sense, so JSON Schema for this was fixed.

Change-Id: I43ea2d20269c9567b3ef99936f63b7c0003170df
'}]
commit_message:
Don't allow queries with 'IN' predicate with an empty sequence

While SQLalchemy-based storage tests running
(test_storage_scenarios.test_query_filter_with_empty_in) there was
invoked SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "sample.resource_id" with
an empty sequence.

Reason is in not checking of 'in' query lists elements number.
These queries make no sense, so JSON Schema for this was fixed.

Change-Id: I43ea2d20269c9567b3ef99936f63b7c0003170df

commit_message:
NSX: add nsx switch lookup to dhcp and metadata operations

The operations in questions were still using the neutron network
uuid as the nsx switch uuid, but this is no longer valid.

Close-bug: #1312439

commit_message:
Add entities for Fuel upgrade

Adds api_version, fuel_version, openstack_version, repo_metadata, puppet_modules_source, puppet_manifests_source to
messages for orchestrator. Corresponding field is added to 'Cluster' DB table. 'ReleaseOrchestratorData' DB table is added.
Additional fixture '/etc/nailgun/fixtures/repodata.yaml' is expected to be provided by puppet on master node installation.
Additional parameter 'version->api' in 'version.yaml' is expected to be provided by puppet as well.

Implements: blueprint fuel-upgrade

Change-Id: Ic86fb52c99aaee6a75536a153ff61fdd776c73f7

commit_message:
Updated content for RDO Icehouse release packages

I made the following changes to update content for the RDO
Icehouse release packages:

1) Changed RDO repository package from
   rdo-release-icehouse-2.noarch.rpm to
   rdo-release-icehouse-3.noarch.rpm.
2) Added "python-glanceclient" to list of packages to install for
   glance.
3) Added "auth_protocol = http" and "auth_port = 35357" to
   glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf.
4) Changed "rpc_backend = nova.openstack.common.rpc.impl_qpid" to
   "rpc_backend = qpid" in nova.conf on all nodes.
5) Removed "python-novaclient" from list of packages to install for
   neutron on the network node.
6) Added "python-neutronclient" to list of packages to install for
   neutron controller node.

Change-Id: I7f2456d5b3ece249abb774b0524fac7639d04ecb
Closes-Bug: #1312921

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-25 07:07:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/controllers.py'], 'message': 'No longer allow listing users by email

As specified in the bug description, the listing of users by using the
email attribute as a filter would cause an exception. This is because
the email is not a first class attribute, yet it was considered so in
the filters. Thus, this fix will prevent the exception while also
preventing the filtering by email.

Change-Id: Ibf4b51a91c1e47e8197af49855307460559a7fc9
Closes-Bug: #1306835
'}]
commit_message:
No longer allow listing users by email

As specified in the bug description, the listing of users by using the
email attribute as a filter would cause an exception. This is because
the email is not a first class attribute, yet it was considered so in
the filters. Thus, this fix will prevent the exception while also
preventing the filtering by email.

Change-Id: Ibf4b51a91c1e47e8197af49855307460559a7fc9
Closes-Bug: #1306835

commit_message:
Added doc for storage policy support in Cinder

Storage policies are specified in the extra spec property
with key "vmware: storage_profile". This property is set
in the cinder volume type.

Change-Id: I6934ef1eae35e18f41f060298e52ff4987a99dd1
Closes-Bug: #1310691

commit_message:
Update README

0.14 is not released, merge changes back to 0.13 and cleanup a bit.

commit_message:
Adds a state metric to ceilometer

To allow accurate billing of VMs based on which state they are in,
this metric polls state on the pipeline interval, but also watches for
any instance events to ensure accurate state transition data.

A couple of new metrics were added (one for polling, and one for
notifications) that both return the same sample meter name. The
implementation is based on the way the instance metric currently
works.

Have also added some basic tests for it, and a module 'vm_states'
which holds the state name -> int mapping.

Measurement added to docs.

Change-Id: I64fc1858b3964427c3d098d0e31d555a567653f4
Implements: blueprint state-meter

commit_message:
Adjust Exception inheritance relationship

* HTTPException is not only ClientException, should inherit directly
  from Exception
* DEPRECATED exception should not be inherited, they will be removed
  in future, so let's decouple it now.

I create a new exception class ClientError as a base class for
all client errors (http status code 4xx), and change them to inherit
from ClientError, this adjustment can also fix bug 1280154.

Change-Id: Ia2a1447b7fbe640e296d4c2322e5fa7013f791c2
Closes-Bug: #1280154

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-09 22:18:35.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Kill spinner process after terminate stack.sh

The last 'echo_summary' call in stack.sh calls a spinner process
but does not kill it. It may continue working (spinning), needing
a kill -9 PID to stop it. This fix ensures that the spinner is
killed at the end of stack.sh

Fixes bug 1302112

Change-Id: I9740d3f561bba45dcc01ce3f3598817f81f516bf
"}]
commit_message:
Kill spinner process after terminate stack.sh

The last 'echo_summary' call in stack.sh calls a spinner process
but does not kill it. It may continue working (spinning), needing
a kill -9 PID to stop it. This fix ensures that the spinner is
killed at the end of stack.sh

Fixes bug 1302112

Change-Id: I9740d3f561bba45dcc01ce3f3598817f81f516bf

commit_message:
Allow case-insensitive security groups

Allocation of security groups is case-insensitive, so adding segroup
rules should be also.

Bug 1286463 shows that security groups are case insensitive in nova
(at least for nova-network, but soon for neutron with c/77347) so
the client should behave the same way.

Change-Id: I455e85326a05f5c399796fc5b3c3bebf875a4334

subject: Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 13:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Partial-bug: #1221190
Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7
(cherry picked from commit d416f4310bb946b4b127201ec3c37e530d988714)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Partial-bug: #1221190
Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7
(cherry picked from commit d416f4310bb946b4b127201ec3c37e530d988714)

commit_message:
Remove extra regexp parenthesis in keypair tests

A trivial thing, but confused me while reviewing another patch. We
wrap the keypair name in parenthesis in these tests and this is
completely redundant since it's a regexp. Remove the parenthesis
to avoid the confusion.

Change-Id: Iff4e5c7dcdef7ee19bb72ecc800fa616555543ec

To avoid update errors from Oslo, all projects importing timeutils will

commit_message:
Remove use of TimeOverride fixture class

The following attributes and functions are planned to be removed in timeutils:
* override_time
* set_time_override()
* clear_time_override()
* advance_time_delta()
* advance_time_seconds()

To avoid update errors from Oslo, all projects importing timeutils will
have the above attributes and functions replaced with other mocking libraries
before they are removed in Oslo.

The TimeOverride fixture was introduced in patch ef5d2af7 for the ease
of writing time dependent test scripts by mocking timeutils.utcnow().
However now that we plan to remove set_time_override (lp 1266962),
this helper class is needed no more.

Mocking timeutils without set_time_override() in TimeOverride does not help
since the test scripts lose control of the mocking value.

Change-Id: I3ee313d8d9ab225215704a2b669bf47b0356f564
Partial-Bug: #1266962

The following attributes and functions are planned to be removed in timeutils:

* advance_time_seconds()

To avoid update errors from Oslo, all projects importing timeutils will

This patch removes all usage of advance_time_seconds(). Following patches

Change-Id: Id964a47daef005e6fd8e3a6e7744f05f53879f60
Partial-Bug: #1266962

commit_message:
Remove use of timeutils.advance_time_seconds

The following attributes and functions are planned to be removed in timeutils:
* override_time
* set_time_override()
* clear_time_override()
* advance_time_delta()
* advance_time_seconds()

To avoid update errors from Oslo, all projects importing timeutils will
have the above attributes and functions replaced with other mocking libraries
before they are removed in Oslo.

This patch removes all usage of advance_time_seconds(). Following patches
will replace the remaining functions and attributes.

Change-Id: Id964a47daef005e6fd8e3a6e7744f05f53879f60

commit_message:
Change Instance Ownership

The idea here is the allow the instance to be relocated. It can receive
a new user and a new project.

This code allows the changes for a new user and a new project, the user
change needs more verification but the project already has quotas check
and it moves the data of the instance from one project to another.

Implements: Blueprint change-instance-ownership

Change-Id: I393dd725a225d8efbd007dc6035f1b3343b40af6

commit_message:
shelve/unshelve does not work when instance created by bootable volume

When instance created by bootable volume,
"shelve/unshelve" does not work properly.
In "shelve" case, root volume does not detached
when the volume does not have encryptors.
So i add volume detach logic when "shelve" process.
And "unshelve" case, the instance does not have
image information when created by bootable volume.
So i add image check logic when "unshelve" process.
These changes will make work properly "shelve/unshelve"
process when instance created by bootable volume.

Change-Id: I62e28f361b9a25719ccddeadbe309bdc56720f3c
Closes-Bug:#1287447

When booting an instance, there is a call to the Neutron API
where it is asked how many networks are present for the tenant.
When a private network and a public network are created under
same tenancy, it raises an Exception while it shouldn't as there
is no reason to allocate a port from a public net only.

Closes-Bug: #1227506
"}]
commit_message:
Fix networks validation by only returning private nets

When booting an instance, there is a call to the Neutron API
where it is asked how many networks are present for the tenant.
When a private network and a public network are created under
same tenancy, it raises an Exception while it shouldn't as there
is no reason to allocate a port from a public net only.

Change-Id: Ie1e6c6b2bb7a52b7261eabe56c2ea6450f2e10c9
Closes-Bug: #1227506

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-11 04:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Fix race problem when check expected state in instance updating

When execute action on instance, compute api will update the
instance's task state. When saving the task state change into
db, the code will check the expected task state. But when two
concurrent requests arrived, the both requests are chance pass
the expected task state checking.

This patch add 'update' lockmode when update instance with
expected_task_state and expected_vm_state. This can prevent
race problem when check expected state.

Change-Id: Ife8beafc5d9375c55d5aa124d4bc7f56e7adf1a2
Closes-Bug: #1291246
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race problem when check expected state in instance updating

When execute action on instance, compute api will update the
instance's task state. When saving the task state change into
db, the code will check the expected task state. But when two
concurrent requests arrived, the both requests are chance pass
the expected task state checking.

This patch add 'update' lockmode when update instance with
expected_task_state and expected_vm_state. This can prevent
race problem when check expected state.

Change-Id: Ife8beafc5d9375c55d5aa124d4bc7f56e7adf1a2
Closes-Bug: #1291246

commit_message:
Update network_cache only if needed

The following patch adds logic so that the network cache
only needs to be updated if needed thus saving an rpc call to the
conductor and a update against the db.

Note the following test 'test_update_nw_info_empty_list' was removed as
the this testcase is included in 'test_instance_info_cache_update_not_called'

Implements blueprint: smarter-network-cache-update

Change-Id: I5f3c772a13d8f624a27720cc985eea9b5cccf2ec

A migration which creates tables for Synchronizer

Synchronizer is supposed to be used to facilitate
cloud scaling and transparent increase of the number of
active schedulers.

commit_message:
Scheduler: host manager cache configuration values

The patch set uses the class to store the configured default filters
instead of reading them from the global configuration. This improves
performance (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85037/)

Change-Id: I1a0e17874cf49d00412c2c9138dc4845b407579e
Closes-bug: #1303481

subject: Refactor test_password_hashed to the backend testers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 18:56:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_backend_kvs.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': "Refactor test_password_hashed to the backend testers

The test_password_hashed method was defined in
test_backend.IdentityTests. This is a bad place for it because not
all backends do password hashing (for example, the LDAP backend
doesn't), and it was also implemented in a way where it called a
private method of the backend, which the SQL backend implemented
differently (it requires an SQLAlchemy session).

The test_password_hashed method is moved into the KVS backend
test class, since the current implementation is specific to the KVS
backend.

Change-Id: I0a2390412de6304b7436e6723cb2d411dd53421d
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor test_password_hashed to the backend testers

The test_password_hashed method was defined in
test_backend.IdentityTests. This is a bad place for it because not
all backends do password hashing (for example, the LDAP backend
doesn't), and it was also implemented in a way where it called a
private method of the backend, which the SQL backend implemented
differently (it requires an SQLAlchemy session).

The test_password_hashed method is moved into the KVS backend
test class, since the current implementation is specific to the KVS
backend.

Change-Id: I0a2390412de6304b7436e6723cb2d411dd53421d

commit_message:
Fix catalog Driver signatures

The 'hints' parameter was missing from the base catalog Driver.
The 'hints' parameter is required for all the subclasses and the
manager requires it, so it should be specified in the base class.

Change-Id: I3e7d84b671468c064d6bb3b2828ce4a03fdd620b

The oslo.messaging library takes the existing RPC code from oslo and
wraps it in a sane API with well defined semantics around which we can
make a commitment to retain compatibility in future.

The patch is large and hard to be split into different patches, but the
changes can be summarized as:

* Remove openstack/common/{rpc, notifier, log_handler} modules dependency
(superceded by oslo.messaging)

* New config option `conductor.workers_pool_size` add to determine the
size of the workers greenthread pool.

* PeriodicService class refactored and renamed to RPCService, all periodic
tasks methods were moved to the ConductorManager class leaving RPCService
class to be resposable for setting up and starting the RPCServer from
oslo.messaging only.

* In oslo.messaging, a request context is expected to be a dict so the
method RequestContext.{to,from}_dict() was updated/added to the module.

* The allowed_rpc_exception_modules configuration option is replaced
by an allowed_remote_exmods get_transport() parameter. This is not
something that users ever need to configure, but it is something each
project using oslo.messaging needs to be able to customize.

also contains transport aliases for backwards compatibility with IceHouse
rpc_backend configuration values.

Change-Id: I454e8898baed002a1cddb9eb76492ae9c2f1212b
'}]
commit_message:
Port to oslo.messaging

The oslo.messaging library takes the existing RPC code from oslo and
wraps it in a sane API with well defined semantics around which we can
make a commitment to retain compatibility in future.

The patch is large and hard to be split into different patches, but the
changes can be summarized as:

* Remove openstack/common/{rpc, notifier, log_handler} modules dependency
(superceded by oslo.messaging)

* New config option `conductor.workers_pool_size` add to determine the
size of the workers greenthread pool.

* PeriodicService class refactored and renamed to RPCService, all periodic
tasks methods were moved to the ConductorManager class leaving RPCService
class to be resposable for setting up and starting the RPCServer from
oslo.messaging only.

* In oslo.messaging, a request context is expected to be a dict so the
method RequestContext.{to,from}_dict() was updated/added to the module.

* The allowed_rpc_exception_modules configuration option is replaced
by an allowed_remote_exmods get_transport() parameter. This is not
something that users ever need to configure, but it is something each
project using oslo.messaging needs to be able to customize.

* New common/rpc.py module added to wrap the global messaging state. It
also contains transport aliases for backwards compatibility with IceHouse
rpc_backend configuration values.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I454e8898baed002a1cddb9eb76492ae9c2f1212b

This patch removes the previous check that verified the mocked

As a consequence, this patch also shortens the test duration.

Change-Id: Ia7bc66e1f2f631e46ddcbe0eacc1d5b2481274cb

commit_message:
Make test_nvp_sync.SyncLoopingCallTestCase reliable

This patch removes the previous check that verified the mocked
looping call had an exact number of calls, and replaces it with a
simpler check that just verifies that the mock has been called.

As a consequence, this patch also shortens the test duration.

Closes-Bug: 1241969

Change-Id: Ia7bc66e1f2f631e46ddcbe0eacc1d5b2481274cb
(cherry picked from commit 4e311e66deb93b459527bd5e9f203720a8e28463)

commit_message:
Remove All Rights Reserved

The phrase is no longer needed as of August 23, 2000 with Nicaragua's
joining of the Berne Convention.

Additionally, in at least one instance,
elements/cache-url/bin/cache-url, its existence in the file between
Copyright lines is just weird and feels misleading, even though it is
not.

Remove all of the lines, because sanity.

Change-Id: I24fd76c2b4f66b8036010b5079db39ead729abee

commit_message:
Spice proxy config setting to be read from the spice group in nova.conf

All spice configuration should be read from the spice group
in the nova config. As it's currently being done in the nova.spice
module.
Renaming spicehtml5proxy_{host, port} parameters to
html5proxy_{host, port}

DocImpact
Change-Id: I36c014c8b8a0796cda494f9450a1fc30104504a1
Closes-Bug: #1308418

subject: Use systemd-nspawn instead of docker for image
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 21:29:29.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/oem/run.sh', 'imagebuild/coreos/oem/system/ironic-python-agent.service', 'imagebuild/coreos/coreos-oem-inject.py'], 'message': "Use systemd-nspawn instead of docker for image

Using systemd-nspawn gives us more flexibility in what hardware the
agent can see. With this setup, the network is not virtualized, and the
/dev inside the container looks nearly identical to the one in the host.

Also added RestartSec=30s to the unit file because without this, systemd
will respawn the agent every 100ms if it dies (say, because DHCP hasn't
completed yet). Since it retries a max of 5 times per 60s, unless the restart value is
set higher it will be marked 'failed' forever and not retry. Adding this prevents that.

Change-Id: Ic64ab4b0824595683e5428464512594dd90eed83
"}]
commit_message:
Use systemd-nspawn instead of docker for image

Using systemd-nspawn gives us more flexibility in what hardware the
agent can see. With this setup, the network is not virtualized, and the
/dev inside the container looks nearly identical to the one in the host.

Also added RestartSec=30s to the unit file because without this, systemd
will respawn the agent every 100ms if it dies (say, because DHCP hasn't
completed yet). Since it retries a max of 5 times per 60s, unless the restart value is
set higher it will be marked 'failed' forever and not retry. Adding this prevents that.

Change-Id: Ic64ab4b0824595683e5428464512594dd90eed83

commit_message:
nova.virt.ironic passes ephemeral_gb to ironic

Make the nova.virt.ironic driver pass the ephemeral_gb flavor spec, if
present, to Ironic via driver_info/pxe_ephemeral_gb. Will also forward
the CONF.default_ephemeral_format value to Ironic.

This patch also adds a default ephemeral format CONF option to
ironic.drivers.modules.pxe, just in case this isn't sent from Nova, eg.
because the config option has no default value.

Closes-bug: #1307726
Change-Id: I445965540c95db7a80c7f8da88e9d4218dcc8f01

commit_message:
Mount target when setting partition GUID

sgdisk is only installed in the target therefore when we run sgdisk
it must be run in-target. For it to succeed the target must be mounted
beforehand.

Change-Id: I952b82c5dba4ab0b1cb924bb1f18f685cc96a51a
Closes-bug: #1312441

subject: N-cpu to not die if Ironic is not running
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-18 14:47:18.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/client_wrapper.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': "N-cpu to not die if Ironic is not running

Don't let n-cpu die if it can't talk to Ironic at start up to get the
list of nodes associated with an instance and the list available nodes,
return an empty list and log the error.

This patch also adds a new MaximumRetriesReached exception that will be
raised by the ClientWrapper when the maximum number of retries reached,
so that we can handle a more specific exception for that type of error.

Closes-Bug: #1309548
Change-Id: I646cdbd3ea6a5a1e8aba85ff576a8e888d1e123d
"}]
commit_message:
N-cpu to not die if Ironic is not running

Don't let n-cpu die if it can't talk to Ironic at start up to get the
list of nodes associated with an instance and the list available nodes,
return an empty list and log the error.

This patch also adds a new MaximumRetriesReached exception that will be
raised by the ClientWrapper when the maximum number of retries reached,
so that we can handle a more specific exception for that type of error.

Closes-Bug: #1309548
Change-Id: I646cdbd3ea6a5a1e8aba85ff576a8e888d1e123d

subject: Added/checked template tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-24 12:33:09.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/cinder-group-active.erb', 'spec/volume_spec.rb', 'templates/default/shares.conf.erb', 'spec/volume-redhat_spec.rb', 'spec/cinder_common_spec.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb'], 'message': "Added/checked template tests

Added inline stubs for endpoint, db_uri, rabbit_servers and
get_password.
In spec/cinder_common_spec.rb, the most complex template, there is a
context for commonly named attributes, those which name matches a
node attribute with keys ['openstack']['block-storage'][attr_key],
storage_availability_zone for instance. This pattern is used in lots
of configuration spec blocks, for example in
['openstack']['block-storage']['vmware'][attr_key].
I've also found what appear to be some incongruences, like duplicated
conditional checks for volume driver types and repeated storwize
settings at the bottom. Perhaps these should be checked in another
bug.
Custom template banners have been added when needed.

Change-Id: I4e90a602caea044d5415ca9b637d19d82f9ab227
Closes-Bug: #1304412
"}]
commit_message:
Added/checked template tests

Added inline stubs for endpoint, db_uri, rabbit_servers and
get_password.
In spec/cinder_common_spec.rb, the most complex template, there is a
context for commonly named attributes, those which name matches a
node attribute with keys ['openstack']['block-storage'][attr_key],
storage_availability_zone for instance. This pattern is used in lots
of configuration spec blocks, for example in
['openstack']['block-storage']['vmware'][attr_key].
I've also found what appear to be some incongruences, like duplicated
conditional checks for volume driver types and repeated storwize
settings at the bottom. Perhaps these should be checked in another
bug.
Custom template banners have been added when needed.

Change-Id: I4e90a602caea044d5415ca9b637d19d82f9ab227
Closes-Bug: #1304412

commit_message:
Update the forwarded ports and remove usage of vagrant-berkshelf

Bring in the changes made by Justin Shepherd in master to stable/havana to make
it easier to work with Vagrant-deployed OpenStack remotely.

As of the time of this commit, vagrant-berkshelf isn't playing nicely with the
other plugins, so instructions have been updated not to use it.

Change-Id: I20d339d3fbfcecbda8142cd21333665bb5c55371

commit_message:
llow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [orchestration-*-bind]
namespaces

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I71a3ab6fa15f5cf128c11af00ec46df07f0959cc

commit_message:
Sync with oslo-incubator 74ae271

This syncs Keystone with oslo-incubator commit hash
74ae2713baf82f0155b71c6e528747f644d73355 .

In keystone:

$ rm -r keystone/openstack/common

In oslo-incubator:

$ python update.py ../keystone

Commits
-------
f61a4e7 Fix python26 compatibility for RFCSysLogHandler
54f7e7f Prevent races in opportunistic db test cases
8a0f581 Use oslotest instead of common test module
7f307c2 generator: sanitize values ending with the fqdn
4a591ea Start ping listener also for postgresql
f0e50ed Add a warning to not use get_table for working with ForeignKeys
fd18c28 Fix safe_encode(): return bytes on Python 3
f0dd798 Remove rendundant parentheses of cfg help strings
6cc96d0 Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3
85d1ce6 Python 3: enable tests/unit/middleware/test_request_id.py
295fcd9 Do not use the 'extend' method on a dict_items object

Change-Id: I90dabcfce78544ceeae7d92f5e5b90d854c5da8d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-24 19:45:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Removed duplication with list_user_ids_for_project

Keystone list_user_ids_for_project has the possibility of returning
duplicate users if the user has more than one role in the project.
list_user_ids_for_project queries the assignment table which has
one entry for every role the user has but will now remove
duplicate combinations of target_id and actor_id. This impacts
V2 calls for tenants.list_users(<tenant_id>) and
users.list(tenant_id=<tenant_id>).

Change-Id: I9a1e5b944c2c627138851976e81d405f54fae1c9
Closes-Bug: #1308218
'}]
commit_message:
Removed duplication with list_user_ids_for_project

Keystone list_user_ids_for_project has the possibility of returning
duplicate users if the user has more than one role in the project.
list_user_ids_for_project queries the assignment table which has
one entry for every role the user has but will now remove
duplicate combinations of target_id and actor_id. This impacts
V2 calls for tenants.list_users(<tenant_id>) and
users.list(tenant_id=<tenant_id>).

Change-Id: I9a1e5b944c2c627138851976e81d405f54fae1c9
Closes-Bug: #1308218

commit_message:
Drivers may expose a top-level passthru API

This allows drivers to implement a vendor method which will be executed on a
random conductor upon any POST to
/drivers/<driver_name>/vendor_passthru/<method_name>, where <method_name> is
an arbitrary path segment which will be passed to the driver_vendor_passthru
method on the vendor interface.

Implements: blueprint nodeless-vendor-passthru
Change-Id: Ia0866e9ca59c8eba7e52eabeb8c88076c54ebbfc

subject: Made mkfs arguments optional and added rootdelay
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 17:46:31.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/scripts/pmanager.py'], 'message': 'Made mkfs arguments optional and added rootdelay

The problem is that we have been creating file systems with -f flag
while it is suitable only for xfs, but not for any other file systems.
Another problem is that some hardware such as ancient Dell equipment
delays exposing raid volumes and grub usually fails not waiting for root
file system is available. rootdelay=90 allows to avoid that kind of
unexpected behaviour.

Backport to stable/4.1 includes a fix for a format string problem that
was present in the original commit merged to master.

Change-Id: I199077b4bf53fdcdc17a89fb4c8ad82bfd966a87
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Borodaenko <dborodaenko@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Made mkfs arguments optional and added rootdelay

The problem is that we have been creating file systems with -f flag
while it is suitable only for xfs, but not for any other file systems.
Another problem is that some hardware such as ancient Dell equipment
delays exposing raid volumes and grub usually fails not waiting for root
file system is available. rootdelay=90 allows to avoid that kind of
unexpected behaviour.

Backport to stable/4.1 includes a fix for a format string problem that
was present in the original commit merged to master.

Change-Id: I199077b4bf53fdcdc17a89fb4c8ad82bfd966a87
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Borodaenko <dborodaenko@mirantis.com>

This change allows that by using attributes from the [orchestration-*-bind]

commit_message:
Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load
balanced IP, but the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [orchestration-*-bind]
namespace

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

commit_message:
Mount target when setting partition GUID

sgdisk is only installed in the target therefore when we run sgdisk
it must be run in-target. For it to succeed the target must be mounted
beforehand.

Change-Id: I952b82c5dba4ab0b1cb924bb1f18f685cc96a51a
Closes-bug: #1312441

"training-labs scripts cleanup

By request, I am posting a cosmetic changeset to clean up spelling,
formatting, whitespace, and comments (some visible by script users) in
training-labs. A few variables and function names have been changed
(decapitalization, consistency).

Scope: This changeset does not affect the workings of the code and
therefore does not fix bugs. Bug fixes go into separate patches.

Special notes:
* Scripts/Neutron/Neutron.sh still installs quantum, but the naming
  within said script is now consistent. That can only be temporary,
  a switch to a more recent release should happen soonish.

* I left the numbers for steps in some scripts (Glance.sh); maybe
  the manuals are meant to refer to these numbers!? Of course, they
  will change occasionally (this time, for instance, I changed them
  to match the actual order).

* Scripts that use non-standard functionality should use bash, not sh;
  shebangs fixed

* I didn't touch README.md, training-guides-cluster-scripts.tar: these,
  too, are for a separate changeset

Related-Bug: #1312764
Change-Id: I01005f96b03ef3fbeeaa0b9d9d0e804aaed7af83
"}]
commit_message:
training-labs scripts cleanup

By request, I am posting a cosmetic changeset to clean up spelling,
formatting, whitespace, and comments (some visible by script users) in
training-labs. A few variables and function names have been changed
(decapitalization, consistency).

Scope: This changeset does not affect the workings of the code and
therefore does not fix bugs. Bug fixes go into separate patches.

Special notes:
* Scripts/Neutron/Neutron.sh still installs quantum, but the naming
  within said script is now consistent. That can only be temporary,
  a switch to a more recent release should happen soonish.

* I left the numbers for steps in some scripts (Glance.sh); maybe
  the manuals are meant to refer to these numbers!? Of course, they
  will change occasionally (this time, for instance, I changed them
  to match the actual order).

* Scripts that use non-standard functionality should use bash, not sh;
  shebangs fixed

* I didn't touch README.md, training-guides-cluster-scripts.tar: these,
  too, are for a separate changeset

Related-Bug: #1312764
Change-Id: I01005f96b03ef3fbeeaa0b9d9d0e804aaed7af83

subject: Spawn support for TaskManager and 2 locking fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-04-23 22:03:25.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_task_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'message': "Spawn support for TaskManager and 2 locking fixes

There's a number of cases where we grab a lock and then spawn a worker
to complete an action. Since the TaskManager() is not being used as a
context manager in these cases, it's really easy to mess this up and
create a code path where we accidentally leave a node locked.

This patch adds support to TaskManager to allow you to spawn a worker
on __exit__. This consolidates all of the logic to make sure we unlock
a node when we should. All cases where we lock and spawn a worker have
been updated to use this.

This happens to fix a bug in set_console_mode() where there's a path
that can leave a node locked. If the console is already in the
appropriate mode, it doesn't spawn a worker, however it would leave
the node locked.

This also fixes a bug in _check_deploy_timeouts() where if the spawn
failed due to something other than NoFreeConductorWorkers or if
the thread-finished-callback linking failed, we would leave a node
locked.

Tests where we're actually testing eventlet's thread behavior with
respect to link() have been moved to the task_manager test file.
They were refactored to remove unnecessary sleeps and incorrect
assumptions about eventlet scheduling. (They assumed that a spawn()
scheduled the new thread immediately.)

self._spawn_worker() tests in test_manager were also moved to their own
test class to be true unit tests.

Change-Id: I6b4ce46e8d1a67a6e1673cc9256b5da3eae3ff32
"}]
commit_message:
Spawn support for TaskManager and 2 locking fixes

There's a number of cases where we grab a lock and then spawn a worker
to complete an action. Since the TaskManager() is not being used as a
context manager in these cases, it's really easy to mess this up and
create a code path where we accidentally leave a node locked.

This patch adds support to TaskManager to allow you to spawn a worker
on __exit__. This consolidates all of the logic to make sure we unlock
a node when we should. All cases where we lock and spawn a worker have
been updated to use this.

This happens to fix a bug in set_console_mode() where there's a path
that can leave a node locked. If the console is already in the
appropriate mode, it doesn't spawn a worker, however it would leave
the node locked.

This also fixes a bug in _check_deploy_timeouts() where if the spawn
failed due to something other than NoFreeConductorWorkers or if
the thread-finished-callback linking failed, we would leave a node
locked.

Tests where we're actually testing eventlet's thread behavior with
respect to link() have been moved to the task_manager test file.
They were refactored to remove unnecessary sleeps and incorrect
assumptions about eventlet scheduling. (They assumed that a spawn()
scheduled the new thread immediately.)

self._spawn_worker() tests in test_manager were also moved to their own
test class to be true unit tests.

Change-Id: I6b4ce46e8d1a67a6e1673cc9256b5da3eae3ff32

commit_message:
Add 'quick deploy' button to app details page

On the application details page there is an 'Add to Env' button but the
'Quick Deploy' button was missing. I've added the Quick Deploy button using
the design pattern implemented on the app tile page, i.e., a button group

Closes-Bug: #1310960
Change-Id: Ib3b86a19f0aae9adaac98167f1e493fa1ad5b219

extracted from oslo incubator. So, we add it to

commit_message:
Fix the "search for sql.py" files for db models

Fix the search logic for sql.py files for the db model import so
that reflection created schemas are consistent.

This does not mitigate the need to move to stevedore in the future
for loading of backends / tests, but does solve the immidiate problem.

Change-Id: If53bfb351d679e3309393c7d594942c55daff3a6
Closes-Bug: #1310768

commit_message:
list func for packages should specify pkg status

Modify the list function so that package listings
specify the 'include_disabled' flag when calling
filter function to retrieve list of packages.

In related commit for #1307963, (commit id:
f51744f, in murano-api) api endpoint ignores
'include_disabled' parameter when passed by
non-admin.

Change-Id: Icdf641e5ea93a34ce79ccbd2c2e33ba46edccc73

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-23 17:17:35.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': 'Adds SSH support to HDP plain VM image

This patch adds the "ssh" element to the list of elements
  used for the generation of the HDP "plain" image.  This image
  does not contain any HDP installed packages, but is configured
  for deploying HDP Hadoop clusters.

This patch also adds the disable-firewall element to the list of
  elements for the generation of the HDP "plain" image.  Recent testing
  showed that the plain image was not supporting cluster startups
  since Apache Ambari requires that the iptables service be turned
  off for nodes in an HDP cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1306726

Change-Id: I3924232495b1f11c61b613d0fa7c6ac669d1b8b8
'}]
commit_message:
Adds SSH support to HDP plain VM image

This patch adds the "ssh" element to the list of elements
  used for the generation of the HDP "plain" image.  This image
  does not contain any HDP installed packages, but is configured
  for deploying HDP Hadoop clusters.

This patch also adds the disable-firewall element to the list of
  elements for the generation of the HDP "plain" image.  Recent testing
  showed that the plain image was not supporting cluster startups
  since Apache Ambari requires that the iptables service be turned
  off for nodes in an HDP cluster.

Closes-Bug: #1306726

Change-Id: I3924232495b1f11c61b613d0fa7c6ac669d1b8b8
