commit_message:
Document the new style instance group filters

Document the ServerGroupAffinityFilter and ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
filters.

Add a note about the deprecated GroupAffinityFilter and
GroupAntiAffinityFilter filters. Also indicate that those filters can't
work together.

Update some markup.

Add notes about the role of the scheduler during migration and
evacuation.

Change-Id: Ibc7989baa336eed698704ca2de38e04f027269b0
Closes-Bug: #1298980
Closes-Bug: #1299066

commit_message:
Improved network interface configuration

Changed network interface configuration to use more generic naming
which improves compatibility with more distributions. For example,
RHEL 7 uses "ens#" rather than "eth#" for interface names. These
changes also required updating various diagrams. This patch also
removes redundant configuration instructions from the "Configure a
compute node" section covered by architecture and basic environment
configuration sections.

Change-Id: Ia3c895d938c341398a9544f5eb10bb7346a29a06
Closes-Bug: #1312273

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-25 09:21:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_version on Python 3.4

Since Python 3.4, argparse has been printing the version on stdout rather than
on stderr as it used to. We should fix this now because:
- this is an issue when packaging oslo-config in Debian Sid, which uses Python
  3.4;
- it will be needed when Openstack switches to 3.4 anyway.

Change-Id: I6a84009acb8621d62465c4cd2573200a07b6b4ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_version on Python 3.4

Since Python 3.4, argparse has been printing the version on stdout rather than
on stderr as it used to. We should fix this now because:
- this is an issue when packaging oslo-config in Debian Sid, which uses Python
  3.4;
- it will be needed when Openstack switches to 3.4 anyway.

Change-Id: I6a84009acb8621d62465c4cd2573200a07b6b4ab

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-21 14:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['climateclient/v1/shell_commands/leases.py', 'climateclient/v1/leases.py'], 'message': 'Add new option to allow lease reductions

The current prolong-for option allows to increment/prolong the
duration of lease by passing a parameter. It could also allow to
reduce the lease duration, but the parameter needs to be passed in
a way that is unclear for the user (for example, --prolong-for " -1d")

With this fix we added a new option to allow lease duration reductions
with a similar option to the "prolong-for".
Both options are mutually exclusive

Change-Id: Ifa616b8d215ed2825f98bea64ce8419866d252d5
Closes-Bug: #1305129
'}]
commit_message:
Add new option to allow lease reductions

The current prolong-for option allows to increment/prolong the
duration of lease by passing a parameter. It could also allow to
reduce the lease duration, but the parameter needs to be passed in
a way that is unclear for the user (for example, --prolong-for " -1d")

With this fix we added a new option to allow lease duration reductions
with a similar option to the "prolong-for".
Both options are mutually exclusive

Change-Id: Ifa616b8d215ed2825f98bea64ce8419866d252d5
Closes-Bug: #1305129

subject: Keep Glance.sh from using the Internet
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-24 07:54:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Glance/Glance.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/PreInstall/PreInstall.sh'], 'message': 'Keep Glance.sh from using the Internet

The scripts running after PreInstall.sh are supposed to work without
an Internet connection ("Internet connection is not required for this
script to run").

However, Glance.sh tried to wget the CirrOS disk image which cannot
work in an offline environment. This patch moves the download into
PreInstall.sh. Also, update CirrOS image from 0.3.1 to 0.3.2.

Change-Id: Ibefbffdda1591ed4561a67edda8a50f17c14aae5
'}]
commit_message:
Keep Glance.sh from using the Internet

The scripts running after PreInstall.sh are supposed to work without
an Internet connection ("Internet connection is not required for this
script to run").

However, Glance.sh tried to wget the CirrOS disk image which cannot
work in an offline environment. This patch moves the download into
PreInstall.sh. Also, update CirrOS image from 0.3.1 to 0.3.2.

Change-Id: Ibefbffdda1591ed4561a67edda8a50f17c14aae5

subject: Fix use of relative paths in Scripts/*/*.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-24 07:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Keystone/Keystone.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/PostInstall/PostInstall.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Nova/Nova.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Horizon/Horizon.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Glance/Glance.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Cinder/Cinder.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/PreInstall/PreInstall.sh', 'doc/training-guides/training-labs/Scripts/Neutron/Neutron.sh'], 'message': 'Fix use of relative paths in Scripts/*/*.sh

Most scripts (e.g. Keystone.sh) assume that they are being started
from their parent directory. This is is not a safe assumption,
especially considering that even test_scripts.sh calls them
from _its_ parent directory (e.g. bash Keystone/Keystone.sh).

This patch introduces a SCRIPT_DIR variable and inserts it wherever
relative paths are used.

Change-Id: Id2ff690e9d4e961dba8aebb8871668e2c6d2dccd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of relative paths in Scripts/*/*.sh

Most scripts (e.g. Keystone.sh) assume that they are being started
from their parent directory. This is is not a safe assumption,
especially considering that even test_scripts.sh calls them
from _its_ parent directory (e.g. bash Keystone/Keystone.sh).

This patch introduces a SCRIPT_DIR variable and inserts it wherever
relative paths are used.

Change-Id: Id2ff690e9d4e961dba8aebb8871668e2c6d2dccd

namespace driver. remove_orphans() is already called by
lbaas agent on start for all drivers

commit_message:
Fix neutron subnets with empty values.

Subnet was expended with ability to set and update parameters like
specifing dns servers, allocation pools and also specific host routes.
Sadly it introduced issue when calling neutron_subnet without specifying
values for these parameters.
Closes-Bug: #1312628

Change-Id: Id1207ab793fc65c43c10afcfe2271e2c02a912d3

commit_message:
Add a new common-venv element

If used will set two environment variables to allow a common
virtual environment to be used with --system-site-packages
enabled so that Nova can pull in python-libvirt.

Change-Id: I8151e2fb9aff322dbe2ffc5982f341120dba6c6c

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-04-19 12:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/horizon/post-install.d/100-horizon-post-install', 'elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/environment.d/10-horizon-venv-dir.bash'], 'message': 'Horizon: dynamically set config time env vars

Updates the Horizon element so that we inject the
HORIZON_VENV_DIR environment variable dynamically at build time
into the os-refresh-config/environment.d directory.
This ensures that the correct value from the build time gets
used during configuration and fixes an issue where the
wrong local_settings.py file is "templated" when using
alternate values for HORIZON_VENV_DIR.

Change-Id: I00c0cb0fa03d6cce5a4625f362cc246d1461c576
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon: dynamically set config time env vars

Updates the Horizon element so that we inject the
HORIZON_VENV_DIR environment variable dynamically at build time
into the os-refresh-config/environment.d directory.
This ensures that the correct value from the build time gets
used during configuration and fixes an issue where the
wrong local_settings.py file is "templated" when using
alternate values for HORIZON_VENV_DIR.

Change-Id: I00c0cb0fa03d6cce5a4625f362cc246d1461c576

subject: Don't manipulate template during abandon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 23:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/tests/test_parser.py', 'heat/engine/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Don't manipulate template during abandon

When deleting a stack during an abandon we want to refrain from deleting
the underlying resources, but there is no need to modify their templates to
do so. In fact, that is highly undesirable because it leaves the system in
an incoherent state, and causes problems for moving away from
templates-as-dictionaries to having an internal template API.

Change-Id: Iddbb3c53342da66f0edadb1e7a314c29a3eff75b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't manipulate template during abandon

When deleting a stack during an abandon we want to refrain from deleting
the underlying resources, but there is no need to modify their templates to
do so. In fact, that is highly undesirable because it leaves the system in
an incoherent state, and causes problems for moving away from
templates-as-dictionaries to having an internal template API.

Change-Id: Iddbb3c53342da66f0edadb1e7a314c29a3eff75b

subject: Don't manipulate LoadBalancer template in-place
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 23:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': "Don't manipulate LoadBalancer template in-place

When autoscaling reloads a LoadBalancer, it adjusts the configuration by
manipulating the LoadBalancer's json_snippet in-place, which is a very bad
policy.

Instead, make a copy of the LoadBalancer resource's template, and use that
that to perform an update.

Change-Id: I0141c3ebc41462f797eb19182a949da0bb4b76a9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't manipulate LoadBalancer template in-place

When autoscaling reloads a LoadBalancer, it adjusts the configuration by
manipulating the LoadBalancer's json_snippet in-place, which is a very bad
policy.

Instead, make a copy of the LoadBalancer resource's template, and use that
that to perform an update.

Change-Id: I0141c3ebc41462f797eb19182a949da0bb4b76a9

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-20 16:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/man/nova-manage.rst', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Deprecate nova-manage flavor subcommand

The nova client already has the following flavor commands:

flavor-access-add    Add flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-access-list   Print access information about the given flavor.
flavor-access-remove Remove flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-create        Create a new flavor
flavor-delete        Delete a specific flavor
flavor-key           Set or unset extra_spec for a flavor.
flavor-list          Print a list of available 'flavors' (sizes of
flavor-show          Show details about the given flavor.

This covers what nova-manage flavor was providing so let's deprecate the
legacy nova-manage subcommand and mark it for removal in the K release.

There is not a bug or blueprint for this. The flavor subcommand is
completely duplicated in nova client. It is accessing the database
directly and we want to move to using flavor objects which would go
through conductor. So this could be considered part of the objects
conversion for flavors.

For some other commands like service, db and host it makes sense to
leave those so you can access the database before the api service is
running, but that's not the case for flavors.

UpgradeImpact: nova-manage flavor command is deprecated, use nova client

Change-Id: I8709bc9af4e490142e44c6dc61fd0aaa3a392b68
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate nova-manage flavor subcommand

The nova client already has the following flavor commands:

flavor-access-add    Add flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-access-list   Print access information about the given flavor.
flavor-access-remove Remove flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-create        Create a new flavor
flavor-delete        Delete a specific flavor
flavor-key           Set or unset extra_spec for a flavor.
flavor-list          Print a list of available 'flavors' (sizes of
flavor-show          Show details about the given flavor.

This covers what nova-manage flavor was providing so let's deprecate the
legacy nova-manage subcommand and mark it for removal in the K release.

There is not a bug or blueprint for this. The flavor subcommand is
completely duplicated in nova client. It is accessing the database
directly and we want to move to using flavor objects which would go
through conductor. So this could be considered part of the objects
conversion for flavors.

For some other commands like service, db and host it makes sense to
leave those so you can access the database before the api service is
running, but that's not the case for flavors.

UpgradeImpact: nova-manage flavor command is deprecated, use nova client

Change-Id: I8709bc9af4e490142e44c6dc61fd0aaa3a392b68

commit_message:
Made get_capabilities a classmethod instead of object method

Capabilities are the same for all objects so there is no need for them
to be nonstatic. Another benefit is that we can check capabilities of
the Connection without the need to create an object and open real
connection.

Change-Id: Ie9314cb49b4c2bffb2bae4d5eeca6f5d8e2637ce

We use /sys/class/block/${tgtdrive}/size to calculate target drive size.
Unlike device files in /dev, paths in /sys have "!" instead of "/", so

commit_message:
Don't replace "!" with "/" for cciss until after size calculation

We use /sys/class/block/${tgtdrive}/size to calculate target drive size.
Unlike device files in /dev, paths in /sys have "!" instead of "/", so
the substitution should not be made until we're done with /sys.

Change-Id: If88c311ceb41e6e3e00ef7e536329477d4243ea7
Closes-bug: #1312311

commit_message:
Don't replace "!" with "/" for cciss until after size calculation

We use /sys/class/block/${tgtdrive}/size to calculate target drive size.
Unlike device files in /dev, paths in /sys have "!" instead of "/", so
the substitution should not be made until we're done with /sys.

Change-Id: If88c311ceb41e6e3e00ef7e536329477d4243ea7
Closes-bug: #1312311

commit_message:
Make logging in the scheduler optional

The calls to logging and translation prove expensive when called
many times for large lists of hosts during the scheduling process.

This introduces a new config variable to allow deployers to enable
the logging when looking to debug their scheduler configuration:
scheduler_enable_logging

We default to doing no longer, the option that gives the best
performance.

WIP - todo raise blueprint

Change-Id: Ic9e8e3bd7f26d2633afc918754972b2fb647799f

commit_message:
Allow to provide a list of uuids for rally task delete

Task delete command now accept a list of uuids :
  rally task delete --force --uuid uuid_1 uuid_2 uuid_3
Previous usages are still available:
  rally task delete --force
  rally task delete --force task_uuid
  rally task delete --force --uuid task_uuid

Change-Id: I85a6225476dab3ff27718d3dadf73810f8da3ebf

NeutronResourcesTestJSON also needed to be modified as it was creating a router

commit_message:
Delete OrchestrationManager, and its unusual credentials

This removes the need for heat tests to be run with admin user
in the demo tenant.

NeutronResourcesTestJSON also needed to be modified as it was creating a router
with external_gateway_info which is enforced by policy as an admin-only operation.
This router is not required for connectivity in this test. An admin scenario
test can be created in the future which creates a router with
external_gateway_info.

Change-Id: Iba26845423b2bf52259a0c0cfab27ae09cfa4e60
Related-Bug: #1089261

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-25 13:47:05.000000000', 'files': ['os_doc_tools/handle_pot.py', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Handle translations for api-site

The generatedocbook command only handled books in subdirectories of
./doc. This assumption only works for operations-guide and
openstack-manuals but not for the api-site. Add parameter --root to give
the root directory. For the api-site, this would be "--root ./".

Change-Id: I9f477239677ca5a32b19bd565f8a37288f7e869e
'}]
commit_message:
Handle translations for api-site

The generatedocbook command only handled books in subdirectories of
./doc. This assumption only works for operations-guide and
openstack-manuals but not for the api-site. Add parameter --root to give
the root directory. For the api-site, this would be "--root ./".

Change-Id: I9f477239677ca5a32b19bd565f8a37288f7e869e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 08:46:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/network/base_api.py', 'nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/network/minidns.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/floating_ips.py'], 'message': "Don't translate debug level logs in nova.network

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if

Change-Id: I8973992d0dd2348f9c657c3caa1cc9c7d79a4c7b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't translate debug level logs in nova.network

Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since nova doesn't support lazy translation yet).

Change-Id: I8973992d0dd2348f9c657c3caa1cc9c7d79a4c7b

commit_message:
Get the sample config files from stable/icehouse

Since the configuration reference is versioned, get the sample files
from the git stable/icehouse branch. This should avoid grabbing trunk
config files when building backports.

Closes-Bug: #1308452
Change-Id: Id7e38ec69345b8a47d48ce6308440a2ec47d8914

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-04-19 12:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-swiftclient-source-install/51-swiftclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-novaclient-source-install/51-novaclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/environment.d/10-openstack-clients-venv-dir.bash', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-ironicclient-source-install/51-ironicclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/bin/install-openstack-client', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-cinderclient-source-install/51-cinderclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-glanceclient-source-install/51-glanceclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-neutronclient-source-install/51-neutronclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-ceilometerclient-source-install/51-ceilometerclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-heatclient-source-install/51-heatclient', 'elements/openstack-clients/install.d/python-keystoneclient-source-install/51-keystoneclient'], 'message': 'Openstack-clients: don't hard code venv

Updates install-openstack-clients so that it parses args rather than
using positional parameters.

Updates the various source install elements so that we use a
new {CLIENTNAME}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory. The in element default is
the same as before (/opt/stack/venvs/python-clientname)

We also add support for controlling the virtualenv
--system-site-packages options by passing -s to the
install-openstack-client bin. This is externally
controllable by setting the {CLIENTNAME}_EXTRA_INSTALL_OPTS
variable. (defaults to "")

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: Ieb90be14a5fb1a644d253777d6468870995372b0
'}]
commit_message:
Openstack-clients: don't hard code venv

Updates install-openstack-clients so that it parses args rather than
using positional parameters.

Updates the various source install elements so that we use a
new {CLIENTNAME}_VENV_DIR variable (set via an environment.d hook)
to configure the virtualenv directory. The in element default is
the same as before (/opt/stack/venvs/python-clientname)

We also add support for controlling the virtualenv
--system-site-packages options by passing -s to the
install-openstack-client bin. This is externally
controllable by setting the {CLIENTNAME}_EXTRA_INSTALL_OPTS
variable. (defaults to "")

This is cleaner in that we aren't hard coding /opt/stack/venv
everywhere and also supports both isolated and shared
venvs (which some people would like to use).

Change-Id: Ieb90be14a5fb1a644d253777d6468870995372b0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-22 13:55:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'lib/tempest: $HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE is not used anymore

Ridiculous patch to remove a not true anymore code comment. If
one wants to have Devstack get a heat compatible image, one
should add HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE=Fedora-i386-20-20131211.1-sda
in his localrc

Change-Id: I2702a322fe1332be5c1301bb32710288ec683350
'}]
commit_message:
lib/tempest: $HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE is not used anymore

Ridiculous patch to remove a not true anymore code comment. If
one wants to have Devstack get a heat compatible image, one
should add HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE=Fedora-i386-20-20131211.1-sda
in his localrc

Change-Id: I2702a322fe1332be5c1301bb32710288ec683350

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-25 12:12:39.000000000', 'files': ['climate/manager/service.py', 'climate/plugins/oshosts/nova_inventory.py', 'climate/policy.py', 'climate/plugins/instances/vm_plugin.py', 'climate/notification/notifier.py', 'climate/plugins/oshosts/host_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Adjust import order according to PEP8 imports rule

This patch just adjust import order to follow PEP8 imports rule.
See http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports

Imports should be grouped in the following order:
1) Standard library imports
2) Related third party imports
3) Local application/library specific imports

Change-Id: Ifb56bbe6ba1ed7682c3326d6429fb34d268e7ea4
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust import order according to PEP8 imports rule

This patch just adjust import order to follow PEP8 imports rule.
See http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports

Imports should be grouped in the following order:
1) Standard library imports
2) Related third party imports
3) Local application/library specific imports

Change-Id: Ifb56bbe6ba1ed7682c3326d6429fb34d268e7ea4

commit_message:
Delete ActiveDirectory application

Move that app into a separare repository:
  https://github.com/murano-project/murano-app-incubator

Then we update our packages to include 'meta' dir into them.

Change-Id: I407540fd5bb307fe02ab15b9a7a04e167ff32e7d

commit_message:
Re-submit "ML2 plugin should not delete ports on subnet deletion"

This patch was previously merged:

Commit: 0d131ff0e9964cb6a65f64809270f9d597c2d5d1

And reverted by this commit da00ed76e6008bd06dada0f0441ae436dd759cdf
in order to check if there was a relation with the gate failures.

Change-Id: Iacb4de8d9aa6a6cbe32c4f41fcf2657f2d09e6e2

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-23 00:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/memorycache.py'], 'message': "Raise exception when importing memcache error

Remove the exception handle and let the ImportError propagate out. This
will provide all of the information that a user would need to figure

Change-Id: I0e608ee15a0826e28dceb162d71d9a1191f0723d
Closes-bug: 1213660
"}]
commit_message:
Raise exception when importing memcache error

Remove the exception handle and let the ImportError propagate out. This
will provide all of the information that a user would need to figure
out what's wrong.

Change-Id: I0e608ee15a0826e28dceb162d71d9a1191f0723d
Closes-bug: 1213660

subject: Cinder list does not filter admin metadata.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-24 12:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "Cinder list does not filter admin metadata.

For example, if you want to filter by 'readonly' attribute,
you do not get results.
This patch adds the admin metadata for filtering.

Change-Id: Ia2a72776e649abd82160cb13ad63489cc760b190
Closes-Bug: #1311277
"}]
commit_message:
Cinder list does not filter admin metadata.

For example, if you want to filter by 'readonly' attribute,
you do not get results.
This patch adds the admin metadata for filtering.

Change-Id: Ia2a72776e649abd82160cb13ad63489cc760b190
Closes-Bug: #1311277

commit_message:
Use rabbitmq notifications for glance

* Add support for rabbit_hosts and rabbit_ha_queues for glance.
* Qpid support is TODO (sync it from upstream as well, then we start to support it again)
* glance::notify::rabbitmq is synced from master trunc puppet-glance in upstream
  * synced its rspecs as well
  * applied a patch in order to fix some existing issues in upstream

Closes bug: #1308104

Change-Id: Ie7e29aa8c9427ec890f7247b6e93116e7dd83b0c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I34b7f390e2ac60d1a35e1bd352d483e0de7a51e1

commit_message:
Add a alarm notification using trusts

This patch adds a new alarm notifier which can be used to talk to an
endpoint using keystone authentication. This allows to do secure alarm
actions.

Change-Id: I634b96443eeaccbd736a812ab551b903c3972540
Implements: blueprint trust-alarm-notifier

commit_message:
allow for NON_STANDARD_REQS override

there are non integrated projects in openstack that use devstack
framework for running jobs. They need a lever in their jobs to
tell the infrastructure that we won't enforce global-requirements
strict compliance on them. We'll still generate a warning so that
they know they are using requirements outside of OpenStack's
accepted list, but it will be non fatal.

Change-Id: Id90547e2fb0a5736385c9f31ba386e7c2e0616df

Kazoo has moved onto 1.3.1

The 0.9 release is over a year old now and kazoo

up the version.

Changes @ https://pypi.python.org/pypi/kazoo#changelog

commit_message:
Remove dependent module py3kcompat

Module py3kcompat was removed from oslo-incubator, we can use
six directly.

* Sync commit of removing py3kcompat from oslo
* use six replace usage of py3kcompat

Change-Id: I15b9ffb10e2d5765a1ed07dd5fd4e2bf7b21ec49
Closes-Bug: #1280033

subject: Fix stress runner signal related issues
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-19 20:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/stress/driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix stress runner signal related issues

The stress runner with -S option needs to stop all workers on error.

* The workers which terminated successfully (0) must be distinguished
  orm the failed workers, and the successfully terminated workers
  MUST not cause mass termination.
* The SIGCHLD single does not needs to be handled anymore when we terminate all
  workers.
* Does not makes sens to handle again and again, the SIGCHLD signal after
  any worker finished with failure.

Change-Id: Ic563f3acaa4e56f5135c438612f1db990b858552
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stress runner signal related issues

The stress runner with -S option needs to stop all workers on error.

* The workers which terminated successfully (0) must be distinguished
  orm the failed workers, and the successfully terminated workers
  MUST not cause mass termination.
* The SIGCHLD single does not needs to be handled anymore when we terminate all
  workers.
* Does not makes sens to handle again and again, the SIGCHLD signal after
  any worker finished with failure.

Change-Id: Ic563f3acaa4e56f5135c438612f1db990b858552

subject: Prevent network interface logging w/ ovs agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 21:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/install.d/90-disable-upstart-network-interface-logging'], 'message': "Prevent network interface logging w/ ovs agent

Openvswitch will create many network interfaces, especially when
supporting a nova compute node. We don't want any bugs in the underyling
OS tools to result in an explosion of network interface specific logs,
as we have seen that this can overwhelm upstart. This is mostly to be
defensive against future problems.

Change-Id: Id8310c5f24ea596ed2443bcb927a07b005980981
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent network interface logging w/ ovs agent

Openvswitch will create many network interfaces, especially when
supporting a nova compute node. We don't want any bugs in the underyling
OS tools to result in an explosion of network interface specific logs,
as we have seen that this can overwhelm upstart. This is mostly to be
defensive against future problems.

Change-Id: Id8310c5f24ea596ed2443bcb927a07b005980981

subject: Add swift-get-nodes, swift-recon and swift-recon-cron
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-04 11:49:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift-storage/install.d/swift-source-install/76-swift-storage', 'elements/swift/install.d/swift-source-install/75-swift', 'elements/swift-storage/install.d/76-swift-storage-common', 'elements/swift-proxy/install.d/swift-source-install/76-swift-proxy'], 'message': 'Add swift-get-nodes, swift-recon and swift-recon-cron

These tools are used used to monitor and diagnose issues with swift:
  o swift-get-nodes is used to find out the location where a
    particular account, container or object item is located within
    the swift cluster
  o swift-recon is used to retrieve various metrics and telemetry
    information about a cluster that has been collected by the swift-recon
    middleware
  o swift-recon-cron is configured as a cronjob and is used to
    track a servers async pending

This commit includes code to create the cronjob /etc/cron.d/swift-recon

Change-Id: Ia83c42c1a028508534c7ed774a27e30b498fc811
'}]
commit_message:
Add swift-get-nodes, swift-recon and swift-recon-cron

These tools are used used to monitor and diagnose issues with swift:
  o swift-get-nodes is used to find out the location where a
    particular account, container or object item is located within
    the swift cluster
  o swift-recon is used to retrieve various metrics and telemetry
    information about a cluster that has been collected by the swift-recon
    middleware
  o swift-recon-cron is configured as a cronjob and is used to
    track a servers async pending

This commit includes code to create the cronjob /etc/cron.d/swift-recon

Change-Id: Ia83c42c1a028508534c7ed774a27e30b498fc811

commit_message:
Stress action for volume attach verify

The new stress action is able to verify the volume attachment,
on the guest.

The ``new_volume`` option can help in finding out the issue is on the
nova side (or on things controlled by nova) or on cider side.

Change-Id: I2d4c8548a2617dd33e2f116fce8b0b3d379b808e

subject: Debug log when token found in revocation list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-22 21:08:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Debug log when token found in revocation list

The auth_token middleware didn't log when a token is rejected
because it's in the revocation list. This adds a log message so
that it's easier to debug problems.

Change-Id: I1388ed04641d209ba2083a1096488edc22267ebe
"}]
commit_message:
Debug log when token found in revocation list

The auth_token middleware didn't log when a token is rejected
because it's in the revocation list. This adds a log message so
that it's easier to debug problems.

Change-Id: I1388ed04641d209ba2083a1096488edc22267ebe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 97, 'name': 'Daryl Walleck', 'email': 'daryl.walleck@rackspace.com', 'username': 'dwalleck'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 8171, 'name': 'Mh Raies', 'email': 'mh.raies@nechclst.in', 'username': 'mh.raies'}, {'_account_id': 8205, 'name': 'Mh Raies', 'email': 'raiesmh08@gmail.com', 'username': 'raiesmh08'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-14 18:16:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_fwaas_extensions.py'], 'message': "Consider state in firewall create/delete test

Firewall creation and deletion happens asynchronously.  It is not possible
to delete firewalls until they have become ACTIVE or to delete policies
or rules until its associated firewall has been completely deleted.

This updates the test_create_show_delete_firewall test to create the tenant
network resources required for an ACTIVE firewall and waits on the the
required state changes.  Also, this omits the 'status' key when comparing
the created firewall with the listed firewall as it is very much transient
during this phase of the test.

Change-Id: I556af59b5b22123229cb4d8ddcac9ce6a8b8f49c
Closes-bug: #1302942
"}]
commit_message:
Consider state in firewall create/delete test

Firewall creation and deletion happens asynchronously.  It is not possible
to delete firewalls until they have become ACTIVE or to delete policies
or rules until its associated firewall has been completely deleted.

This updates the test_create_show_delete_firewall test to create the tenant
network resources required for an ACTIVE firewall and waits on the the
required state changes.  Also, this omits the 'status' key when comparing
the created firewall with the listed firewall as it is very much transient
during this phase of the test.

Change-Id: I556af59b5b22123229cb4d8ddcac9ce6a8b8f49c
Closes-bug: #1302942

Implements: blueprint mistral-engine-standalone-process

commit_message:
Engine as a standalone process

Refactored engine to run as a standalone process. The engine is
modified to use the RPC client/server design pattern from
oslo.messaging. A new launch option is included to run the
engine separately. The API server communicates with the engine
via the RPC client. A pecan hook is used to pass a common client
instance with appropriate transport configuration to the API.

Change-Id: I9ca757aedad764fd38645a5b858800d69808bb95
Implements: blueprint mistral-engine-standalone-process

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-03 10:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/memorycache.py'], 'message': "log a warning when memcache couldn't be imported

If the memcached_servers configuration option is set, but the memcache
python module cannot be imported, the client used to fall back to the in
process cache silently. This change logs that switch as a warning.

Change-Id: I4015cf9f9dd60096fe968a99f0041dd647d2ad83
"}]
commit_message:
log a warning when memcache couldn't be imported

If the memcached_servers configuration option is set, but the memcache
python module cannot be imported, the client used to fall back to the in
process cache silently. This change logs that switch as a warning.

Change-Id: I4015cf9f9dd60096fe968a99f0041dd647d2ad83

commit_message:
NSX: Add ability to retry on 503's returned by the controller

There are a number of circumstances where the NSX controller
may return 503. Currently the API client does not retry, so
this patch adds a retry logic with timeout.

Closes-bug: #1284277

Change-Id: I85df087d5ae409e6cb5c35eb171e89346abe81f4
(cherry picked from commit cb99c08e968685c6f59bab2e49f86d56a2ec509d)

In Keystone V3 user names are no longer necessarily unique

A user can still authenticate a user in the non default
domain via the V2 API providng they use IDs instead of names.

Tenant_ID is already supported, this change adds support
for user ID

Closes-Bug: #1299807

Change-Id: I22fdd9a6749f7dfbdd2dc8313fddc81e5ea0b753

commit_message:
Allow user ID for authentication

In Keystone V3 user names are no longer necessarily unique
across domains.

A user can still authenticate a user in the non default
domain via the V2 API providng they use IDs instead of names.

Tenant_ID is already supported, this change adds support
for user ID

Closes-Bug: #1299807

Change-Id: I22fdd9a6749f7dfbdd2dc8313fddc81e5ea0b753

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-15 13:50:13.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_drivers_compatibility.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_t_dorado.py', 'cinder/tests/db/test_qos_specs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup_tsm.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup_driver_base.py', 'cinder/tests/test_zadara.py', 'cinder/tests/db/test_finish_migration.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v1/test_limits.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup_ceph.py', 'cinder/tests/db/test_name_id.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/test_emc_smis.py', 'cinder/tests/db/test_transfers.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume_configuration.py'], 'message': "Replace tearDown with addCleanup - Part 4

Infra team has indicated that tearDown should not be used and should
be replaced with addCleanup in all places.

All addCleanup methods will be executed even if one of them fails, while
a failure in tearDown method can leave the rest of the tearDown un-executed,
which can leave stale state laying around.

Moreover, tearDown methods won't run if an exception raises in setUp method,
while addCleanup will run in such case.

This patch replaces tearDown with addCleanup or removes redundant tearDown
methods in cinder unit tests.

Implements blueprint replace-teardown-with-addcleanup

Change-Id: I6947eafa419ed7dda53582484090cd5210274f73
"}]
commit_message:
Replace tearDown with addCleanup - Part 4

Infra team has indicated that tearDown should not be used and should
be replaced with addCleanup in all places.

All addCleanup methods will be executed even if one of them fails, while
a failure in tearDown method can leave the rest of the tearDown un-executed,
which can leave stale state laying around.

Moreover, tearDown methods won't run if an exception raises in setUp method,
while addCleanup will run in such case.

This patch replaces tearDown with addCleanup or removes redundant tearDown
methods in cinder unit tests.

Implements blueprint replace-teardown-with-addcleanup

Change-Id: I6947eafa419ed7dda53582484090cd5210274f73

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2014-04-24 13:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/catalog/backends/sql.py'], 'message': 'Compatible server default value in the models.

MySQL has no native boolean type. MySQL boolean type is just an alias
to tiny int type field. So MySQL returns '"1"' for `true` value and
'"0"' for false value. Instead of it, Postgres has native boolean type.
Thus with Postgres, reflection of a boolean type column default value will
return either 'true' or 'false'. Model must have compatible
`server_default` argument in columns definition.

Change-Id: Id0107d510dd7087e61ae851a1f3ff18334851a68
Partial-Bug: #1292591
'}]
commit_message:
Compatible server default value in the models.

MySQL has no native boolean type. MySQL boolean type is just an alias
to tiny int type field. So MySQL returns '"1"' for `true` value and
'"0"' for false value. Instead of it, Postgres has native boolean type.
Thus with Postgres, reflection of a boolean type column default value will
return either 'true' or 'false'. Model must have compatible
`server_default` argument in columns definition.

Change-Id: Id0107d510dd7087e61ae851a1f3ff18334851a68
Partial-Bug: #1292591

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2014-04-24 13:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/oauth1/migrate_repo/versions/005_consumer_id_index.py', 'keystone/common/sql/migrate_repo/versions/050_fk_consistent_indexes.py'], 'message': "Explicit foreign key indexes.

Overview:
MySQL requires indexes on foreign keys. Such an index is created on the
referencing table automatically if it does not exist.

Motivation:
MySQL names foreign keys indexes differently dependent from itself
version. Implicit fk indexes is MySQL specific behavior, so it should be
ignored during comparision. We plan to use Alembic to compare models and
migrations I0758c7e09d1d46ce870c3f94f76c2a177955e143. Alembic doesn't support
5.5 naming convention. So we need consistent index name for all MySQL versions
to be easily ignored.

Solution:
A new migration script renames incorrectly named fk indexes on MySQL.

Reproduction:
Stop execution when foregn keys will be initialized. See schema with
your MySQL shell client. With 5.5, indexes which was not named
explicitly, will have a name such as <tablename>_<columnname>_fk, with 5.1 it
will be <columnname>.

Change-Id: I01ba0c8856afbda59394395ac319bf83a55ee2be
Partial-Bug: #1292591
"}]
commit_message:
Explicit foreign key indexes.

Overview:
MySQL requires indexes on foreign keys. Such an index is created on the
referencing table automatically if it does not exist.

Motivation:
MySQL names foreign keys indexes differently dependent from itself
version. Implicit fk indexes is MySQL specific behavior, so it should be
ignored during comparision. We plan to use Alembic to compare models and
migrations I0758c7e09d1d46ce870c3f94f76c2a177955e143. Alembic doesn't support
5.5 naming convention. So we need consistent index name for all MySQL versions
to be easily ignored.

Solution:
A new migration script renames incorrectly named fk indexes on MySQL.

Reproduction:
Stop execution when foregn keys will be initialized. See schema with
your MySQL shell client. With 5.5, indexes which was not named
explicitly, will have a name such as <tablename>_<columnname>_fk, with 5.1 it
will be <columnname>.

Change-Id: I01ba0c8856afbda59394395ac319bf83a55ee2be
Partial-Bug: #1292591

commit_message:
Revert default Ubuntu release back to Saucy

Trusty ramdisks do not boot, failing to exec init.  This reverts
the default DIB_RELEASE back to Saucy until Trusty ramdisks have
been properly tested.

Change-Id: I5ac81822b78805275268cecc021a74a62c22ef58

commit_message:
Fixes trove create output

Reasons:
- When using trove create, the output for create instance shows all
  unwanted information as described in bug, like flavor details
  and datastore as a dict.

Changes:
- Moved the configuration attribute setting to top before setting up
  any other attribute.

Change-Id: I5d508f5ee3937097086f08bbfad3642f7d63f288
Closes-Bug: #1282338

commit_message:
Adding VNC params to over and undercloud metadata

This change is to allow to specify via Heat the main VNC configuration
parameters.
The default values defined here are the values we have at this moment in the
image elements for nova.conf.
The follow-up of this change will be in the image elements to create a VNC
guard around the VNC values to make them configurable via Heat.

Change-Id: If083a45242ecb39e25fbe9c73fe7488cd82c884c

commit_message:
Fixes indistinguishable 'None' and NoneType in list/show response

Print hyphen '-' if attribute value is NoneType so that it is
distinguishable when 'None' string is used as attribute value.
Attribute can be 'Description', 'Name' etc.

* This change affects output of every cinderclient action

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iadc3a1c87f9d684b7721c5365bd54f94e6cc2d0e
Closes-Bug: #1261713

subject: Expose container info on deleted containers.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-09 22:53:14.000000000', 'files': ['swift/cli/info.py', 'swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_info.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'test/unit/account/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Expose container info on deleted containers.

Include basic container info headers (X-Container-Object-Count, X-Timestamp,
etc.) on 404 responses from the container server.  Default empty values are
used as placeholders if the database does not exist.

Specifically the X-Backend-Status-Changed-At and the future
X-Storage-Policy-Index value will be needed by the reconciler to deal with
reconciling out of order object writes in the face of recently deleted
containers.

 * Add "status_changed_at" key to the response from ContainerBroker.get_info.
 * Add "Status Timestamp" field to swift.cli.info.print_db_info_metadata.
 * Add "status_changed_at" key to the response from AccountBroker.get_info.

Change-Id: I7531bfcb42a9abcbb50b2e1d7a835c0fc88e8537
'}]
commit_message:
Expose container info on deleted containers.

Include basic container info headers (X-Container-Object-Count, X-Timestamp,
etc.) on 404 responses from the container server.  Default empty values are
used as placeholders if the database does not exist.

Specifically the X-Backend-Status-Changed-At and the future
X-Storage-Policy-Index value will be needed by the reconciler to deal with
reconciling out of order object writes in the face of recently deleted
containers.

 * Add "status_changed_at" key to the response from ContainerBroker.get_info.
 * Add "Status Timestamp" field to swift.cli.info.print_db_info_metadata.
 * Add "status_changed_at" key to the response from AccountBroker.get_info.

Change-Id: I7531bfcb42a9abcbb50b2e1d7a835c0fc88e8537

subject: Adding manage_service parameter to keystone
revisions:

When set to false, enables puppet to configure a service without
starting/stopping it on each run.  This may be necessary when
using an external clustering system (Corosync/Pacemaker, for

Change-Id: I89fc7e8f4e5e083af8b4ddf803028e2a78613529
'}]
commit_message:
Adding manage_service parameter to keystone

When set to false, enables puppet to configure a service without
starting/stopping it on each run.  This may be necessary when
using an external clustering system (Corosync/Pacemaker, for
example).  Defaults to true.

Change-Id: I89fc7e8f4e5e083af8b4ddf803028e2a78613529

subject: fix bash8 failure condition
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-26 00:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['tools/bash8.py'], 'message': "fix bash8 failure condition

bash8 wasn't reseting the multiline variable at the end of a run,
so it was actually failing to catch errors in a file if it was
tricked into multiline at the end of a previous one.

redo how we are processing the file list so this is reset before
each file starts.

Change-Id: Ic85d884088d8a84e6f34f2b642559c1017fe1378
"}]
commit_message:
fix bash8 failure condition

bash8 wasn't reseting the multiline variable at the end of a run,
so it was actually failing to catch errors in a file if it was
tricked into multiline at the end of a previous one.

redo how we are processing the file list so this is reset before
each file starts.

Change-Id: Ic85d884088d8a84e6f34f2b642559c1017fe1378

subject: Use a setup-hook to generate config sample
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 14:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/setup_hooks.py', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Use a setup-hook to generate config sample

We seem to get bitten by reading config from libraries
that change and end up going through some frustration
getting things back on track.

Add a hook that will generate the sample configuration file and include
it to the extra_files when running the sdist command. It won't do
anything for all the other commands.

The hook won't fail if the generation of the file fails to prevent the
command from failing if not all the requirements are available.

This change is based off the Nova change Ia2d395eac5bc14f1c88dbdd8660fd7349a20f467
Authored by Xavier Queralt

Change-Id: I3b7389eef48999dd77d6c3d325711810b37b9d2e
Closes-bug: #1301519
"}]
commit_message:
Use a setup-hook to generate config sample

We seem to get bitten by reading config from libraries
that change and end up going through some frustration
getting things back on track.

Add a hook that will generate the sample configuration file and include
it to the extra_files when running the sdist command. It won't do
anything for all the other commands.

The hook won't fail if the generation of the file fails to prevent the
command from failing if not all the requirements are available.

This change is based off the Nova change Ia2d395eac5bc14f1c88dbdd8660fd7349a20f467
Authored by Xavier Queralt

Change-Id: I3b7389eef48999dd77d6c3d325711810b37b9d2e
Closes-bug: #1301519

commit_message:
Fix various Pep8 1.5.4+ fallout

There are various bugs in detecting indentation issues in Pep8 1.4.6.
Fix the issues in the code base in preparation of upgrading to
a newer Pep8 release.

Issues in detail:

- E131 continuation line unaligned for hanging indent
- E265 block comment should start with '# '

Change-Id: Ia161cc17c2aa2f857ce21f95a97a81e188f6b438

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-04 16:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/linuxbridge/test_lb_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'lb-agent: reduce delete_vlan_bridge() logging severity

delete_vlan_bridge() always gets called twice: once by daemon_loop()
and once by the network_delete() rpc. This results in errors being
logged on every network delete, and sometimes exceptions when there
is a race. This patch catches exceptions and reduces logging severity.

Change-Id: Id220fcf3afd8d3fd57283672323711829e1e35ab
Closes-Bug: 1284311
'}]
commit_message:
lb-agent: reduce delete_vlan_bridge() logging severity

delete_vlan_bridge() always gets called twice: once by daemon_loop()
and once by the network_delete() rpc. This results in errors being
logged on every network delete, and sometimes exceptions when there
is a race. This patch catches exceptions and reduces logging severity.

Change-Id: Id220fcf3afd8d3fd57283672323711829e1e35ab
Closes-Bug: 1284311

The test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk tried to:
- handled  sub functions as object method
- Tried to get the fixed IP address from the first (BUILD) server response.
- Handled the partition number incorrectly
- Created an additional server without a need
- Expected incorrect status codes on the v3 test
- v3 version created more disk (+swap)

Implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk

The test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk tried to:
- handled  sub functions as object method
- Tried to get the fixed IP address from the first (BUILD) server response.
- Handled the partition number incorrectly
- Created an additional server without a need
- Expected incorrect status codes on the v3 test
- v3 version created more disk (+swap)

Change-Id: Iad55c4c7e247f1b3534ff41400feea2faf939863
Implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy

Remove legacy block device usage in ec2 API

This patch makes the single place that would get the block device
mappings from the database, not convert objects to legacy format,

Also fixes fake values in tests.

When booting an instance with a port specified, if the instance spawn
failed for libvirt error, the instance will be rescheduled, and will raise
a "PortInUse" exception.
This patch allows allocating port which used by the instance self in

Change-Id: Iaf8a7414841bed9de7f9d507b17dcb02832ffe78
Closes-bug: #1308405
(cherry picked from commit 51f287cf90565d6c32c6ec9dac2b30f8a20c3abe)

commit_message:
Allow allocating port which used by instance self

When booting an instance with a port specified, if the instance spawn
failed for libvirt error, the instance will be rescheduled, and will raise
a "PortInUse" exception.
This patch allows allocating port which used by the instance self in
allocate_for_instance().

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py

Change-Id: Iaf8a7414841bed9de7f9d507b17dcb02832ffe78
Closes-bug: #1308405
(cherry picked from commit 51f287cf90565d6c32c6ec9dac2b30f8a20c3abe)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-04-23 09:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/ec2utils.py'], 'message': "DescribeInstances in ec2 shows wrong image-message

If one instance boots from a volume,
the value of 'image_id' by 'DescribeInstances' in ec2,
will be a wrong number.

The value of 'image_ref' for this type of instances, is '', not None.
So the original protected codes can't take efforts.

Change-Id: I8c5e1c626f2b7873e7720f3615db1ee1ec6c681a
Closes-Bug: #1278696
"}]
commit_message:
DescribeInstances in ec2 shows wrong image-message

If one instance boots from a volume,
the value of 'image_id' by 'DescribeInstances' in ec2,
will be a wrong number.

The value of 'image_ref' for this type of instances, is '', not None.
So the original protected codes can't take efforts.

Change-Id: I8c5e1c626f2b7873e7720f3615db1ee1ec6c681a
Closes-Bug: #1278696

commit_message:
Verify list agents attributes of V2/V3 APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2/V3 list agents APIs
includes the attributes to block the backward incompatibility change
in the future.

The response body of v2 and v3 API is the below:

{
    "agents": [
        {
            "agent_id": 1,
            "hypervisor": "xen",
            "os": "linux",
            "architecture": "x86",
            "version": "7.0",
            "url": "xxx://xxx/xxx/xxx1",
            "md5hash": "add6bb58e139be103324d04d82d8f546"
        }
    ]
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I59fc1a54b32554d7c9827ce912d3197f78c4cd12

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-24 20:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_revoke.py'], 'message': 'Make test_revoke expiry times distinct

Calling _future_time had the possibility of returning the same value
if it is called between clock ticks.  It appears to be happening in
gate, potentially due to being run in a VM.

Instead, for the loop that revokes distinct events,
Assign each a different expires_at time.

Change-Id: Iab7ed92bb1e142651265a167ae73d6d1225b01a9
Closes-Bug: #1300581
'}]
commit_message:
Make test_revoke expiry times distinct

Calling _future_time had the possibility of returning the same value
if it is called between clock ticks.  It appears to be happening in
gate, potentially due to being run in a VM.

Instead, for the loop that revokes distinct events,
Assign each a different expires_at time.

Change-Id: Iab7ed92bb1e142651265a167ae73d6d1225b01a9
Closes-Bug: #1300581

commit_message:
Use requests module for HTTP/HTTPS

This change introduces the use of requests in lieu of httplib2
to ensure proper handling of SSL termination.

Implements: blueprint tls-verify

subject: Fix url parsing for api version check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 20:13:39.000000000', 'files': ['tools/verify_tempest_config.py'], 'message': "Fix url parsing for api version check

This commit fixes a couple of oversights in the common api version
check function. The previous version of the method would never work
because the url wasn't passed to urlparse, and the resulting endpoint
url would be missing a ':' even if it were.

Change-Id: I4b6bb47f0601063aa8164ded386ca71adc6ccc80
"}]
commit_message:
Fix url parsing for api version check

This commit fixes a couple of oversights in the common api version
check function. The previous version of the method would never work
because the url wasn't passed to urlparse, and the resulting endpoint
url would be missing a ':' even if it were.

Change-Id: I4b6bb47f0601063aa8164ded386ca71adc6ccc80

commit_message:
keypair name should strip leading&trailing spaces

When create keypair, leading&trailing spaces is not stripped.
As a user, we don't distinguish one space or two spaces.
so we should strip leading&trailing space from keypair name.

Change-Id: I17618eeb9316aaf587cfdd84689bd334f294b5f2
Closes-Bug: #1304776

subject: Make OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size not-required
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 04:54:04.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api_schema/compute/v2/images.py'], 'message': 'Make OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size not-required

On Nova v2 API, "show volume info" API returns a response which
includes 'OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size' attribute but it is not required
because it is one of API extensions. Deployers can disable this
extension as they demand, and some environments don't provide the
attribulte.

This patch makes the attribute not-required on the API schema.

Change-Id: I82abd094a216076b6aa5e591d2148fd780d0677d
'}]
commit_message:
Make OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size not-required

On Nova v2 API, "show volume info" API returns a response which
includes 'OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size' attribute but it is not required
because it is one of API extensions. Deployers can disable this
extension as they demand, and some environments don't provide the
attribulte.

This patch makes the attribute not-required on the API schema.

Change-Id: I82abd094a216076b6aa5e591d2148fd780d0677d

commit_message:
Add check that service tag isn't in path name

This commit adds a new hacking check to ensure that a service tag
isn't added on a test whose path includes the service tag being added.
Having a service tag added where the path already contains the service
name is redundant.

Partially implements bp add-service-tags

Change-Id: I88b3005d05e17751045d766efb1e965822a3c50e

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-07 19:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/keystone/os-apply-config/etc/keystone/keystone.conf'], 'message': 'Configurable Keystone token provider

Allow configuration of Keystone token provider via Heat template
variable "keystone.token_provider". Variable may be set to token
provider class name, like core classes
"keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider",
"keystone.token.providers.uuid.Provider" or some custom implementation.
If variable is not set, token provider will be set toa default
"keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider".

Change-Id: I01eeaee3ce46a67ebef8379282b32353a93145ac
'}]
commit_message:
Configurable Keystone token provider

Allow configuration of Keystone token provider via Heat template
variable "keystone.token_provider". Variable may be set to token
provider class name, like core classes
"keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider",
"keystone.token.providers.uuid.Provider" or some custom implementation.
If variable is not set, token provider will be set toa default
"keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider".

Change-Id: I01eeaee3ce46a67ebef8379282b32353a93145ac

commit_message:
fix dict reference error

network item in the return of _list_networks() is dictionary. Its
keys can not be referenced like object's property. This patch fix
that problem.

Change-Id: I01d8e69b4e2a3350cb7afc3fc076992ef9ab9783

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-22 00:35:45.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': 'Also pass FWAAS conf to VPN agent if enabled

If q-vpn is enabled, the Neutron neutron-vpn-agent is started
instead of the neutron-l3-agent, but only neutron-l3-agent receives
the fwaas_driver config when q-fwaas is enabled.  This ensures the FW driver
config is passed to either so that a properly configured agent is running
when the FWAAS extensions are enabled.

Closes-bug: #1310858

Change-Id: I237d2831a6b87ae46dfef047d3dc0b85fa6423d3
'}]
commit_message:
Also pass FWAAS conf to VPN agent if enabled

If q-vpn is enabled, the Neutron neutron-vpn-agent is started
instead of the neutron-l3-agent, but only neutron-l3-agent receives
the fwaas_driver config when q-fwaas is enabled.  This ensures the FW driver
config is passed to either so that a properly configured agent is running
when the FWAAS extensions are enabled.

Closes-bug: #1310858

Change-Id: I237d2831a6b87ae46dfef047d3dc0b85fa6423d3

subject: Add bridge_mappings to extras/80-opendaylight.sh to support vlan isolation.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-23 15:20:36.000000000', 'files': ['extras.d/80-opendaylight.sh'], 'message': 'Add bridge_mappings to extras/80-opendaylight.sh to support vlan isolation.

OpenDaylight integration with Openstack requires some extra configuration
information to be set in the ovsdb via the other_config value. Currently
only the local ip address is set. bridge_mappings needs to be added to support
vlan isolation.

This requires changing the form of the existing ovs-vsctl command to set
the other_config value. The current command does a replace so the last
command to run overwrites any other values. The command is changed to
append values instead.

Change-Id: Ia001ecf27c8f5ace05af014ecce0b13f6d490ac1
'}]
commit_message:
Add bridge_mappings to extras/80-opendaylight.sh to support vlan isolation.

OpenDaylight integration with Openstack requires some extra configuration
information to be set in the ovsdb via the other_config value. Currently
only the local ip address is set. bridge_mappings needs to be added to support
vlan isolation.

This requires changing the form of the existing ovs-vsctl command to set
the other_config value. The current command does a replace so the last
command to run overwrites any other values. The command is changed to
append values instead.

Change-Id: Ia001ecf27c8f5ace05af014ecce0b13f6d490ac1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-22 19:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py'], 'message': 'Add API for creating translation functions

After gettextutils moves to a library, we will not be able to rely on
a single set of global translation functions. Each library will need
its own functions, using a different translation domain, so the right
message catalogs can be loaded.

Since we know when the factory is created which version of Python is
used and whether or not lazy translation should be enabled, return
functions that do the translation without checking those settings
at runtime for each message.

bp graduate-oslo-i18n

Change-Id: I0a177f70e71f1a5708d9e50ff0399eba6ec02c1c
'}]
commit_message:
Add API for creating translation functions

After gettextutils moves to a library, we will not be able to rely on
a single set of global translation functions. Each library will need
its own functions, using a different translation domain, so the right
message catalogs can be loaded.

Since we know when the factory is created which version of Python is
used and whether or not lazy translation should be enabled, return
functions that do the translation without checking those settings
at runtime for each message.

bp graduate-oslo-i18n

Change-Id: I0a177f70e71f1a5708d9e50ff0399eba6ec02c1c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-24 20:29:22.000000000', 'files': ['etc/barbican/barbican-api.conf', 'barbican/crypto/dogtag_crypto.py', 'barbican/tests/crypto/test_dogtag_crypto.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add Dogtag crypto plugin.

This patch adds an initial version of the Dogtag plugin
that implements the decrypt(), encrypt() and generate()
functions.  In this version, we will create and initialize
an NSS database on the server to do crypto operations
within the Dogtag DRM python client.  This allows us to
decrypt() and encrypt() secrets without passing in wrapping
keys.

When the barbican-client and the Barbican server API have
been changed to pass through the wrapping keys, this plugin
will need to enhanced to make the relevant DRM client calls.

This plugin has been tested by running the barbican server
within a virtual environment.  There are several steps
needed to get things configured, which are detailed in the
blueprint.

Added unit tests.  These unit tests will be skipped if the
dogtag dependencies are not present to import.

Change-Id: Ib53bf3df5a65af7ac602ec7f7895e9c723c36c06
Implements: blueprint dogtag-plugin
'}]
commit_message:
Add Dogtag crypto plugin.

This patch adds an initial version of the Dogtag plugin
that implements the decrypt(), encrypt() and generate()
functions.  In this version, we will create and initialize
an NSS database on the server to do crypto operations
within the Dogtag DRM python client.  This allows us to
decrypt() and encrypt() secrets without passing in wrapping
keys.

When the barbican-client and the Barbican server API have
been changed to pass through the wrapping keys, this plugin
will need to enhanced to make the relevant DRM client calls.

This plugin has been tested by running the barbican server
within a virtual environment.  There are several steps
needed to get things configured, which are detailed in the
blueprint.

Added unit tests.  These unit tests will be skipped if the
dogtag dependencies are not present to import.

Change-Id: Ib53bf3df5a65af7ac602ec7f7895e9c723c36c06
Implements: blueprint dogtag-plugin

commit_message:
Sync latest code and reuse exceptions from oslo

Module `ironicclient.exc` contains exceptions which equal to exceptions
from oslo common code.
This patch:
- sync latest code of `apiclient.exceptions`(hash of last commit in oslo
related to apiclient.exceptions: 3570f44d5ccf52c59cc586bed1446b874fc3c07c)
- reuses exceptions from common code
- removes needless exceptions from `ironicclient.exc`

Related to bp common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I784007f36dd6a63fc4c77e0d0f0f000e05eb792f

commit_message:
Some smaller fixes for openSUSE 13.1 support

* dnsmasq-utils is also required on openSUSE 13.1 (for dhcp_release)
* make sure that iscsid is actually started. On openSUSE it's not
  started by default.

subject: Accept new parameters for `prepare_image`
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-04-24 20:00:39.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/shell/copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': 'Accept new parameters for `prepare_image`

The parameters sent to `prepare_image` changed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86490/

This patch brings `prepare_image` up to date with that change.
It also changes the way configdrive is written to disk, to match
that Ironic is now allowing Nova to build an ISO partition and
send the raw image to the agent.

This patch also swaps out subprocess.call for processutils.execute
in the standby module, since the commands were being changed anyway.

Lastly, this patch changes the expected `hashes` dict to be a
string parameter called `checksum`, to match what glance returns.

Change-Id: Id8af9be920ba51e7e1ce60f4ffd1477e413582c9
'}]
commit_message:
Accept new parameters for `prepare_image`

The parameters sent to `prepare_image` changed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86490/

This patch brings `prepare_image` up to date with that change.
It also changes the way configdrive is written to disk, to match
that Ironic is now allowing Nova to build an ISO partition and
send the raw image to the agent.

This patch also swaps out subprocess.call for processutils.execute
in the standby module, since the commands were being changed anyway.

Lastly, this patch changes the expected `hashes` dict to be a
string parameter called `checksum`, to match what glance returns.

Change-Id: Id8af9be920ba51e7e1ce60f4ffd1477e413582c9

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 09:46:43.000000000', 'files': ['elements/serial-console/cleanup.d/99-fix-grub'], 'message': 'Disable splashimage for legacy grub.

There is a known issue in legacy grub. When using splashimage with
serial console, Legacy grub wont start properly. This commit is to
ensure that when serial console is used, legacy grub should not
contain splashimage. It also adds serial support to legacy grub
configuration file.

Change-Id: I2007916998dfe7c66ef51bf8c57c1698dc0fcb75
'}]
commit_message:
Disable splashimage for legacy grub.

There is a known issue in legacy grub. When using splashimage with
serial console, Legacy grub wont start properly. This commit is to
ensure that when serial console is used, legacy grub should not
contain splashimage. It also adds serial support to legacy grub
configuration file.

Change-Id: I2007916998dfe7c66ef51bf8c57c1698dc0fcb75

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-22 20:05:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nvplib.py', 'neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nicira_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/fake_nvpapiclient.py'], 'message': 'NSX: Fix 404 from raising on update_port if lswitch not in nsx

If one calls update_port and the lport is not stored in the nvp_lport_mapping
table in the database and the lswitch the lport resides on is not in nsx
we should catch NotFound and return the port in error state. This patch fixes
this for havana and also corrects the fake_api_client to raise NotFound in this
case. This problem does not exist in IceHouse though as we query NSX with *
which does not raise NotFound.

Change-Id: Ia01f900ade714b512b49fd3e803159a27599fee1
Closes-bug: #1311300
Related-bug: #1311291
'}]
commit_message:
NSX: Fix 404 from raising on update_port if lswitch not in nsx

If one calls update_port and the lport is not stored in the nvp_lport_mapping
table in the database and the lswitch the lport resides on is not in nsx
we should catch NotFound and return the port in error state. This patch fixes
this for havana and also corrects the fake_api_client to raise NotFound in this
case. This problem does not exist in IceHouse though as we query NSX with *
which does not raise NotFound.

Change-Id: Ia01f900ade714b512b49fd3e803159a27599fee1
Closes-bug: #1311300
Related-bug: #1311291

subject: Speed up license checks
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-23 17:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/comments.py'], 'message': "Speed up license checks

Previously the function _project_is_apache would get called twice for
every line being checked. And this function would read the file
'LICENSE' every time.

Since we don't expect 'LICENSE' to change during the run of hacking,
cache the result.

Using cProfile, _project_is_apache took:
Before: 1.030
After: 0.008

Change-Id: I762ad0f910f59c7844d283b7965b28628d6273b6
"}]
commit_message:
Speed up license checks

Previously the function _project_is_apache would get called twice for
every line being checked. And this function would read the file
'LICENSE' every time.

Since we don't expect 'LICENSE' to change during the run of hacking,
cache the result.

Using cProfile, _project_is_apache took:
Before: 1.030
After: 0.008

Change-Id: I762ad0f910f59c7844d283b7965b28628d6273b6

subject: Only compile regex for hacking_except_format once
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-23 17:03:42.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/except_checks.py'], 'message': 'Only compile regex for hacking_except_format once

Instead of using re.match which compiles the regex each time use
re.compile and re.search. A small scale timeit test shows this method
reduces the time needed by about 60%.

Change-Id: I613a4c07776ec9e00bb09bd9c52074862436b559
'}]
commit_message:
Only compile regex for hacking_except_format once

Instead of using re.match which compiles the regex each time use
re.compile and re.search. A small scale timeit test shows this method
reduces the time needed by about 60%.

Change-Id: I613a4c07776ec9e00bb09bd9c52074862436b559

subject: Uniquely identify builds to prevent race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 18:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/docker_build.bash'], 'message': 'Uniquely identify builds to prevent race

In the original implementation of this, the latest running container
containing "PICKME" was selected for the container to export. This
creates a race condition.

Instead we now identify the image by a UUID created each run, so that
they will not overlap if multiple builds happen simultaneously.

Change-Id: Iaaf5683435f424517774067a1d95732ad096c988
'}]
commit_message:
Uniquely identify builds to prevent race

In the original implementation of this, the latest running container
containing "PICKME" was selected for the container to export. This
creates a race condition.

Instead we now identify the image by a UUID created each run, so that
they will not overlap if multiple builds happen simultaneously.

Change-Id: Iaaf5683435f424517774067a1d95732ad096c988

commit_message:
gw_port should be set as lazy='join'

This forces the object to be ready ahead of accessing time.
The change in loading behavior is also beneficial while listing
routers, as reduces the amount of queries being issued. Tests
show a performance gain of 15-30% for router-list times.

As Mr. Aaron Rosen is used to saying: Woot woot!!

Closes-bug: #1309144

Change-Id: Ibae261b91de26ca7c50e3f6c80e9be2a799785a3
(cherry picked from commit 966dbb5368d710e2652b18f5b9cb4295f58598da)

commit_message:
ENV['RELEASES'] overrides the [cuttlefish dumpling emperor]

The RELEASES environment variable contains the list of ceph releases for
which integration tests are going to be run. This is convenient to speed
up tests when debugging the logic of the implementation and before
making sure it works accross all distributions.

Change-Id: I0d0a6af6f07aeba72c42e6f853353ccf97db8658
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

commit_message:
Move files common for mysql and mariadb under mysql-common

Because galera library path has to be set in mysql config file,
we create a symlink during install time to make sure that there is
always same path for mysql and mariadb and for all architectures.

Change-Id: Iea3264932ec621d3d7618c5c50cbe47a956fb332

subject: Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 22:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': "Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node

There was a bug in the code that checked to see if the
appropriate WWPN for a preferred node was available on the storage
host in intialize_connection.  It was assumed that there would only
ever be one preferred WWPN.  The code just checked to see if the list of
preferred WWPNs was in the list of available WWPNs.  This would only work
if all of the WWPNs were available on the storage host.  This resulted in
volumes not being able to be mounted when they should have been
available.

This fix changes the check of the preferred WWPNs to check each
item in the list until one is found.  The first one found is used
as the target WWPN.  If no match is found, the old default behavior
of selecting the first available WWPN is used.  I have added a
warning message for this case as it is quite possible that this
won't work in the user's environment as was the case that uncovered
this bug.

Note that this change is only relevant for systems that are not using
multipath as systems that use multipath don't choose one WWPN, they
just send the whole available list back.

Change-Id: I8d3239da24a8f9fbd8309ba5c90b05b29a068754
Close-bug: 1308298
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling multiple WWPNs on preferred FC node

There was a bug in the code that checked to see if the
appropriate WWPN for a preferred node was available on the storage
host in intialize_connection.  It was assumed that there would only
ever be one preferred WWPN.  The code just checked to see if the list of
preferred WWPNs was in the list of available WWPNs.  This would only work
if all of the WWPNs were available on the storage host.  This resulted in
volumes not being able to be mounted when they should have been
available.

This fix changes the check of the preferred WWPNs to check each
item in the list until one is found.  The first one found is used
as the target WWPN.  If no match is found, the old default behavior
of selecting the first available WWPN is used.  I have added a
warning message for this case as it is quite possible that this
won't work in the user's environment as was the case that uncovered
this bug.

Note that this change is only relevant for systems that are not using
multipath as systems that use multipath don't choose one WWPN, they
just send the whole available list back.

Change-Id: I8d3239da24a8f9fbd8309ba5c90b05b29a068754
Close-bug: 1308298

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-04-22 13:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/radware/test_plugin_driver.py', 'neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/radware/driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the
IP that the outside world sees (VIP) and the IP that the servers
respond to (PIP) are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network also used as the HA network instead of using the
vDirect container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728
'}]
commit_message:
Add 2-leg configuration to Radware LBaaS Driver

Radware's load balancer currently supports three network interfaces.
Prior to this code addition, the configuration of those three
interfaces was: one interface for management, one for high
availability backup, and one for load balancing servers where the
IP that the outside world sees (VIP) and the IP that the servers
respond to (PIP) are identical.

This change adds a new "2-legged" configuration: one interface for
management, one interface for a VIP network, and one interface for the
PIP and the high availability backup network.

During VIP creation, the LBaaS driver detects if the incoming
configuration is "2-legged" by comparing VIP and PIP networks.  If they
are different it allocates a new port on the PIP network in order to
obtain an IP address for the PIP and names that port after its
associated VIP ID.  vDirect is then directed to create a load balancer
with the PIP network also used as the HA network instead of using the
vDirect container's default HA network configuration.

During VIP deletion, the LBaas driver detects if a port for the PIP
had been previously allocated by searching for and deleting port names
that map to the VIP ID.

Change-Id: Ifb93159c654f16958842f646c119479c465230f9
Closes-Bug: 1268728

commit_message:
Deprecate instance_get_all_by_filters() from conductor

This deprecates the instance_get_all_by_filters() method from
conductor, which is no longer used.

This also removes a test that was mocking the conductor method,
but that really tests nothing at all. Perhaps a new test to ensure
that the period=0 case is handled properly is in order, but this
test definitely wasn't doing that.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I1e7bc19296d1773bbc2f5f9e77a1faf0e6ac1fe6

commit_message:
Make a bigger column for storing task results in mysql

This patch adds new 2 types called BigText that actually use LongText
instead of Text in case of mysql

And use this new type for colum with task results
